text: 1. A burnt stick?2. Ivan Milat?3. A 100ml tub of mango yoghurt 12 days past it's use by date?4. Bill Shorten?5. A two day old pile of dried bird poop on a car roof?
author: TimOfAltona

text: So the consensus of the Labor cheer squad, in this thread at least, is that it matters not whom leads Labor to the next election, it could be a burnt stick, Ivan Milat or tub of mango yogurt 12 days past it's use by date and Labor will still win.
author: TimOfAltona

text: In other words, no-one has any confidence in Shorten be an effective leader of the opposition and Labor's only hope is that Abbott's unpopularity will, with a lot of help from the Greens, get them over the line.
author: TimOfAltona

text: What a hopeless bunch of dreamers. Grow some balls, fix up your own party, get a leader that people look up to and go out and win the election in your own right.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Way too much baggage for the electorate to bear - knifing two sitting Labor PM's, rape allegations, AWU impropriety allegations (about to be properly tested), caught out lying to the media, disliked by the Labor left, unable to drive much needed reform in the ALP, poor performer on his feet and on and on it goes.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Let's face it, if Shorten was good enough or even up to the task of reforming Labor he would not be increasingly viewed by most as their greatest liability.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Bottom line, Labor cannot win with Shorten as leader and Rudds little 'reform' on the way out the door makes it bloody difficult for them to get rid of him.
author: TimOfAltona

text: The left want to be careful in trying to portray Mullah as some kind of anti-government poster boy of theirs....that can very quickly backfire and is exactly why we hear nothing from Shorten on this.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Agreed. However when you are the PM of a country, the media swarm over every word you utter and you tend to attract more attention than 'any other citizen'.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Abbott gave his views on the merits of the ABC's decision to give this Mullah fellow a platform in the first place and again when they stuffed up by re-broadcasting the original 'error of judgement' as Mark Scott had originally labelled it.
author: TimOfAltona

text: The ABC, as the national broadcaster has an obligation to serve the interests of Australia and Australians - they are not in the business as media platform for individuals who engage in criminal anti-Australian activities or propaganda - which is exactly where Scott's admission of the 'error of judgement' came in.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Plenty of other Australian media outlets have given Mullah plenty of airtime or copy to spread his message. The Guardian even gave him his own front page opinion piece.
author: TimOfAltona

text: We have not heard the PM or Turnbull criticise those media outlets - they are free to run with anything they want - but the tax payer funded ABC, whilst independent, operate under a very different charter from commercial media.
author: TimOfAltona

text: The left want to be careful in trying to portray Mullah as some kind of anti-government poster boy of theirs....that can very quickly backfire and is exactly why we hear nothing from Shorten on this.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Mark Scott admitted they made a mistake in giving that idiot a platform on Q&A, then they go and replay the broadcast a couple of days later. Someone stuffed up and presumably the inquiry into the incident will flush out how that error occurred and also how they can avoid a repeat of having a person like Mallah appearing on Q&A in the future.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Would be a piece of cake to sort out Labor's problems...plain as day where it is not working and why, plus what needs to be done to turn the ship around.
author: TimOfAltona

text: For what you propose can only facilitate the latter - look at what's happening between Nth Africa and southern Europe. Where is your sense of humanity over this issue?
author: TimOfAltona

text: The Australian government, with the support of Labor has got this one right. The boats are no longer arriving, the detention centres are being emptied and closed, children in detention are rapidly decreasing, the drownings have stopped and Australia are welcoming genuine refugees through the controlled UNHCR program.
author: TimOfAltona

text: We voted for that in Sept 2013 and the government we elected has delivered on that and more than likely will be re-elected on the same platform come next federal election.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Good luck with that......processing claims for asylum can take years....tens of thousands will still pay people smugglers to get them to Australia, particularly if they think they will be allowed to stay on arrival - another Greens policy I understand.
author: TimOfAltona

text: In the absence of that I suggest things are best left with the current government to stop the mass drownings, which is exactly what Australia voted for in Sept 2013 and will vote for again next year.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Reminds me a bit of Malcolm Turnbull's piece he wrote when his dog Mielle passed away in 2013. Also moving stuff and a bit of a window into Malcolm's compassionate persona - also worth a read.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Always interesting when the MPs return to their respective sides passing amongst each other following a vote in the lower house - the camaraderie between some of those from the government and those from the opposition is on display. Not a bad thing at all.
author: TimOfAltona

text: QT is pure theatre - the opposition structure its questions to try and entrap the government knowing they will not elicit a serious or direct answer and the government use the dixers to push their barrow and try and land blows on the opposition.
author: TimOfAltona

text: That is what a senate is for - if it does not stack up (according to Labor and the Greens) in current form it won't pass the current senate. Pretty straight forward really.
author: TimOfAltona

text: It seems pretty clear to most Australians that if you go off to fight in wars, especially wars against Australia, or engage in terrorism activities there should and will be consequences.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Good to see the government closing the loopholes for those consequences. Let's all hope this bill gets through parliament swiftly and we can all get on with more pressing matters impacting Australia now and in the immediate future - fiscal reform.
author: TimOfAltona

text: I can see the remnants of the Labor/Greens cheer squad all hopping on their soap boxes this morning as they witness the prospect of their party getting back into government (well for the next 2 or 3 terms at least) getting even more remote.
author: TimOfAltona

text: There is a valid reason for that...until Labor and the Greens can present a  alternative government to the Australian people, not just sitting around hoping an unpopular PM will deliver them office, then they have little prospect.
author: TimOfAltona

text: While the dysfunction continues down at team Labor, Abbott continues to easily wedge the ALP and comes out on top time and time again. Labor and the Greens would be better to focus on the 2019 election as the one to try and turn things around - providing they have the right leadership team plus other reform around factions in place.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Reality is they are not. We saw the rampant dysfunction during the Rudd/Gillard/Rudd years and Labor went ahead a in a bizarre move, inserted a fellow who was a major player/instigator of all that dysfunction as their new leader.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Labor's reform and rebuild has barely begun. It starts with sorting out the leadership debacle and getting a team in who are at least electable in the minds of voters.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Fair comment, but Australia would not be the trail blazers here - NZ have gone through 2 increases to 15% over recent years with minimal adverse impact, in fact the Key government was returned with an increased majority after raising the GST to 15% and NZ's economy (which does not enjoy the mining revenues Australia has) is in great shape.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Forget the GST carve up, just raise the bloody thing to 12.5%, still exempt fresh food, and hey presto our states suddenly have plenty more dosh to fund schools, hospitals, roads and other infrastructure in addition our budget situation is looking a whole lot better.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Only an LNP government would take a GST increase to an election, Labor are all at sea when it comes to fiscal reform plus their ideology is a roadblock, but the ALP will certainly back it if the government gets a mandate.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Gimme a break. You can only go so far in trying to protect one of your own. Your comment is exactly why Labor have no hope of getting back into government.
author: TimOfAltona

text: It's fairly worrying that so many of the Labor cheer squad are trying to build a fence around this Mallah bloke to protect him from the "evil Ciobo"
author: TimOfAltona

text: We get that it's all in the name of protecting one of your own, but all you are achieving is confirming in people's minds that Labor and their Greens partners cannot be trusted with the nation's security.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Spoken like a true Gillard supporter. I have a lot of time for Joel. He tells it like it is, even calling out his own side when they stuff up. No spin. Refreshing.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Good to see Bill Shorten come out and support the government on the fuel excise tax - another piece of legislation sailing through the senate with the help of Labor. You get the feeling everything is coming together for the government quite nicely. All good.
author: TimOfAltona

text: So you are perfectly comfortable, if you have young children, to allow them to play and hang out with these children who have been witnessing and participating in (at the behest of their father) beheadings, carrying around severed heads and god knows what other atrocities?
author: TimOfAltona

text: This is a huge problem as to how these children can be integrated back into Australian schools, muslim or otherwise. A change of identity might assist, counselling might assist, but the risks are huge.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Don't get too excited people, until these two are positively confirmed dead, there is a strong probability this is a setup. Plenty of people before them have faked their own deaths in an attempt to come back to Australia or some other country under a different identity to avoid capture.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Typical of the Labor/Greens cheer squad -a massive void exists when it comes to who should replace - Labor are all but ruled out through dysfunction and lack of leadership, so we all wait with anticipation.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Problem with that proposition is that a vote for the Greens is a vote for Labor, always has been - in fact so irrelevant are the Labor party in current day politics that they have no hope of ever returning to government without the help of the Greens.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Funny how Clive was the darling of the leftie set when they thought he was causing trouble for the government only to be an instant pariah once they realised Clive had conned them by lulling them into a false sense of security. LOL.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Have nothing against unions..there is a definite and constructive place for them in our country...what I don't like are corrupt union executives and officials who rip off their members for personal benefit and use stand over tactics with employers & routinely protected when the ALP are in government. It takes an LNP government to flush them out...the old adage..the LNP is the best friend workers ever had rings very true.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Labor would test the patience of any speaker....if they actually stopped ignoring the 2 or 3 warnings to STFU from the Speaker they would not be thrown out at the rate they are. Only have themselves to blame. The Speaker is doing an admirable job IMHO.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Also, the Speaker made a big mistake in overturning her decision to boot Dreyfus out....Labor MPs are like lemmings and they will all start staying put when thrown out under 94A, hoping Bishop will allow then to stay - more mayhem and childish antics from the Labor party as they continue on their path to remaining in opposition for years to come IMHO.
author: TimOfAltona

text: I'm with you anything and everything that goes wrong in the world is Tony Abbott's fault - hell, a bird shat on my car windscreen this morning and we all know that is definitely the PM's fault.
author: TimOfAltona

text: I heard Di Natale today say that Labors biggest problem is they try and sit on the fence on too many issues, in other words they stand for nothing. Sums up the situation perfectly.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Spot on. You only need to see who makes up the bulk of Labor members in the Senate to see where their true interest lies - for many of them, it sure as hell ain't the workers.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Expect to see a re run of The Killing Season during next years election campaign, just to remind voters of why the ALP can't be trusted under this current leadership team.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Good to see things not only being passed but other policy initiatives being delivered upon. The Greens did the right thing this week on pensions and exposed labor for what they are, dysfunctional ideological dinosaurs and the Small Business initiative which locks hundreds of thousands of small businesses in behind the government passed the senate. Also noting that the FTA with China came a step closer. All good.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Personally, I hope he stays, with all his baggage he is such an easy target for the government and will all but guarantee another term for the LNP. All good.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Tune into The Killing Season on the ABC this Tuesday evening to see the final enthralling episode of the collapse of the Labor Party...I hear Zinger boy is featured - it's going to be a doozy!
author: TimOfAltona

text: She still has her training wheels on - I mean can you seriously see her representing Australia at major global conferences...would not have a clue what people are saying around her. Way way out of her depth at any examination.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Plibersek is hopeless. Whoever is scripting this rank amateur wannabe foreign minister is leading her up the garden path and in her naivety she's taken the bait. This obvious crass political posturing can come back and backfire on Plibersek and Labor big time..and it will.
author: TimOfAltona

text: You completely missed yesterday's thread on why Shorten is a liability for Labor and should be replaced...funny, going by the hundreds of comments it seems not only the Guardian columnists but the majority of Labor supporters were calling for him to go too. Here's the link in case you missed it......
author: TimOfAltona

text: Newsflash pal - your mate Bill Shorten ain't looking too crash hot in the leadership stakes...you clearly could not click on yesterday's column about how Bill Shorten will lead Labor over the cliff...here's the link and read the comments, most of them are from Labor supporters wanting Shorten gone.......
author: TimOfAltona

text: Once you have digested what the majority of people are thinking about Shorten, tune into Episode 3 of The Killing Season on the ABC on Tuesday night....it's waht referred to as the icing on the cake.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Apologies to those who disagree with me posting this in this thread, but we've just about had enough of Labor cheer squad people hijacking threads such as this to propagate their personal prejudices and bile.
author: TimOfAltona

text: They remind me of the angry crowd scenes in the Simpsons cartoons, all standing there with their flaming torches, nooses and pitchforks - one of them makes an accusation and the whole crowd immediately and blindly go along with it. LOL.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Well you may be happy to kowtow to the corrupt Indonesian regime, grovel grovel, but good thing we have a government that stands up for Australian sovereignty and protection of our borders. God only knows Labor and the Greens can't be trusted - look at the disaster they created before they were thrown out by the voters.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Lets make one thing perfectly clear, this boat was yet another attempt by the people smugglers to create a new business model, this time boats to NZ, after the Australian government shut down their boats to Australia model which had been operating so successfully under the Labor/Greens government.
author: TimOfAltona

text: How the left get regularly sucked in by and happily play into the hands of the people smugglers is a clear signal that a Labor/Greens government cannot be trusted with Australian maritime border security.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Best Indonesia sort out the rampant corruption which allows maritime people smugglers to operate. Noone gives a shit whether or not Australia handed over a few dollars to turn the boats around - the main thing is the boats have been stopped, the drownings have stopped and that's what we all voted for at the last election.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Nicely poetic...Labor's problems are much deeper than just leadership dysfunction. The ongoing tension between the left and the right is constantly bubbling away below the surface...take asylum seekers as a prime example...the ALP are unable to offer any kind on policy statement on this because the left and right will never agree . The left will lean towards the Greens and the right will lean towards the government where they think the votes will lie.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Albo is genuinely a good bloke, a real warrior for the left of the ALP and I agree, he would be streets ahead of Shorten as leader. However, that's as good as it gets, he is not PM material. Labor need to find another leader who has Albo in his/her corner as Deputy and mentor.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Labor are crumbling before our very eyes. Shorten has more baggage on him than a Samsonite dealers convention....Labor's in a tight spot, they want to get rid of Shorten, but given the revelations coming out of The Killing Season on the ABC at the moment, know that voters won't forgive another leadership knifing so they are in a real bind.
author: TimOfAltona

text: In the meantime, the government seems to be getting on with passing legislation, getting it's budget through and sorting out the fiscal mess left behind by the failed Rudd/Gillard/Rudd years. The choice is clear IMHO.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Where did 'millions' come from, apart from your fertile imagination. Best stick with the facts, in this case an allegation of $30k, or else it looks like you make crap up all the time.
author: TimOfAltona

text: I'm with you, the last thing we want is for the media to ask Shorten embarrassing questions that may put his credibility into question. Better all of Shorten's background is swept under the carpet and forgotten. Still won't save him though.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Well, perhaps if labor were good enough the media may decide that they are worth a go. Labor, with Shorten as leader are miles away from looking anything like a viable alternative government at the moment...maybe something positive will come out of the national conference, maybe not.
author: TimOfAltona

text: With all this Labor navel gazing going on, Abbott must be very tempted to go early. Maybe wait to see what emanates from the Royal Commission (it could get ugly for Shorten) and then strike. Maybe.
author: TimOfAltona

text: There is a massive difference, Shorten is viewed as a key player in the removal of a sitting Labor PM, not once, but twice and then he goes on to lead the party himself.
author: TimOfAltona

text: The Killing Season on the ABC will most likely snuff out any serious move to replace Shorten. Knifing yet another leader so soon after the Rudd/Gillard/Rudd debacle will pretty much ensure Labor will be viewed as a political rabble unable to get their own house in order. They need to stick with Shorten through to the next election and give him every opportunity to deliver.....if he fails to deliver, then he will step down and an orderly transition to a new leader will occur.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Not at all. I have always said and believed Turnbull would make a better PM for the country. Not alone on that one, I know many Labor and Greens supporters who would be tempted to back a Turnbull lead government over what Labor have to offer right now.
author: TimOfAltona

text: All of the governments front bench have performed well on their feet today. Run rings around the hapless opposition who probably have only 1 or 2 effective speakers - time for a clean out.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Abbott is right....Labor will be doing plenty of embarrassed laughing in weeks to come. The noose is slowly closing around Shorten's neck...I don't know one person who thinks he can survive to the next election.......you only have to look at this article in today's Guardian......
author: TimOfAltona

text: If Labor knife Shorten it's safe to say they can look forward to at least another term in opposition. If Shorten survives the night of the long knives, Labor can likewise look forward to at least another term in opposition. Just the way it is.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Labor are too easily wedged on this issue.....they make it easy for the government to corner them..that said, Abbott can only bang this drum for only so long before it becomes white noise.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Good to see the hapless Plibersek slapped down in QT. God, she is such a liability for the current Labor party front bench. The sooner she and Shorten are jettisoned from the leadership team the sooner Labor can start the rebuild. In the meantime, mediocrity rules.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Gillard did that at the behest of John McTernan hoping it may dig her out of the bloody great hole she made for herself. What you didn't see was the earpiece hidden under her hair with a direct line back to McTernan scripting her.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Perhaps a combination of the two events will assist Labor combat their inner demons and seriously address reform before it's too late? The conference may be a good starting point but could easily turn into a shit fight if the left don't get their way on border protection and asylum seekers.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Problem for Labor is they make themselves a big target by refusing to acknowledge they have a massive problem. If Dreyfus believes Shorten has unified the Labor Party he's living in lala land.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Yes, the walls certainly seem to be closing in on Shorten and Labor. Perhaps the ALP may want to consider reform as good course of action, otherwise it's looking like a very slippery slope they are headed for right now.
author: TimOfAltona

text: As much as the Labor/Greens want the boats to start up again, this government is too strong. The boats have stopped arriving, the people smugglers are all but out of business, the detention centres are being emptied out, children in detention are reducing each week and no one is drowning trying to reach Australia. A great result - but it has taken a long time to clean up Labor's mess.
author: TimOfAltona

text: All these pollies raising big bucks for great charities and all the cheer squad can do is bitch and moan about it like some shrivelled up Scrooge sitting in a darkened cellar with a candle burning and tapping away on a crusty old keyboard hating the world.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Labor and its hapless supporters must be feeling a bit like the jilted lover today, how dare those bed hopping Greens do the dirty on us and hop into someone else's bed , in broad daylight too!
author: TimOfAltona

text: Labor's brains trust must be working overtime to work out a way to woo the Greens back into the blood soaked bed of the ALP in time for the next election, because without them, Labor are finished.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Blaming the media for all Labor's misfortunes is delusional. You only have to watch The Killing Season on the ABC last night to see how most of Labor's problems are self inflicted.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Funny thing happened afterwards in Lenore's thread - I happened to mention that Julia Gillard was poisonous for the Labor party and I received 14 'likes' against that comment - most likes against a single comment than I have received in the past year in the Guardian threads.
author: TimOfAltona

text: The Labor/Greens cheer squad are wounded today...this is how they react when their side is clearly struggling to gain any sort of credibility, some say legitimacy, so it's all about lashing out at the 'enemy' including anyone who has an alternate view. Nothing new though, par for the course one could say.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Not until they get real on the refugee problem. Australia cannot accept hundreds of thousands of refugees over and above the current orderly intake and we certainly don't want them coming here by deadly people smuggling boats.
author: TimOfAltona

text: I'd love to be a fly on the wall at their morning tactics meeting...I reckon I could do a better job on directing a course of action for them they they are doing now.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Pretending it never happened and looking the other way is exactly what Labor need to do to ensure they remain unelectable for years to come. Let's hope Labor follow your lead.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Labor suddenly stopped asking questions on the subject today because it surfaced that they may have been doing in government exactly what they were accusing the government of the day before.
author: TimOfAltona

text: C'mon Daisy we all know Gillard was being heavily scripted by McTernan at that time. It was his tactic to play the misogyny card to try and reverse her failing popularity and framed her speeches to see if it would work for her. Plenty of gullible people were sucked in because they wanted to believe it.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Perhaps Julia should suggest John McTernan heads over to the US to assist Hillary's campaign. He can advise her on how to best play the sexism card to try and gain a sympathy vote as he did with Julia's campaign to hold onto the ALP leadership.
author: TimOfAltona

text: The chances are good - Labor carry way too much baggage when it comes to stabbing serving PM's in the back and I doubt they will want to go down that path again.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Shorten knows he has zero chance of winning an election without the Greens. He knows what the Greens want when it comes to asylum seekers, but he also knows what the majority of Australians want. Shorten and the cheer squad know full well they can lose the next election on this issue alone. Not looking good for Labor you have to say.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Looks like Shorten is hoping he can make it an election and sneak across the line without telling us what Labor will do about stopping the boats if they were to gain government.
author: TimOfAltona

text: You get the feeling though that all this current noise about boats and people smugglers is benefiting the government....reconfirms in voters minds that the government is doing a bloody good job in shutting down the people smugglers, stopping the boats and saving hundreds if not thousands of lives.
author: TimOfAltona

text: People only have to look at the tragedy occurring on a daily basis between Nth Africa and Europe to see what happens when maritime people smugglers are allowed to operate with impunity. I think Australian voters can spot the huge difference between the LNP and the Greens on this issue hence the Greens have one seat in the lower house - Labor we have no bloody idea, nor do they.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Come back to us and show the link where the government said they would shut down the maritime people smuggling business all over the planet, in the Andaman Sea included. *crickets*
author: TimOfAltona

text: The government has stopped the boats arriving in Australia...just what we voted for last election and has been delivered upon. Don't the left just hate that (which is why they are out of government - for a long time to come)
author: TimOfAltona

text: You get the feeling though that all this current noise about boats and people smugglers is benefiting the government....reconfirms in voters minds that the government is doing a bloody good job in shutting down the people smugglers, stopping the boats and saving hundreds if not thousands of lives.
author: TimOfAltona

text: People only have to look at the tragedy occurring on a daily basis between Nth Africa and Europe to see what happens when maritime people smugglers are allowed to operate with impunity. I think Australian voters can see the huge difference between the LNP and the Greens on this issue - Labor we have no bloody idea, nor do they.
author: TimOfAltona

text: No surprises whatsoever that the Labor/Greens cheer squad are in here rooting for their Julia Gillard 'Captains Pick' poster girl - lol, as if it would have been any other result in their eyes.
author: TimOfAltona

text: The Labor/Greens cheer squad are up in arms about the current government's success in this area...yet they have no idea how the party they want to see in govt will handle this issue.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Can anyone actually show anything that proves this assertion (paying money) is even true, or is it just refugee lobbyist propaganda that's gone viral - you know - anything that can get the boats started up again is a good thing 'n all that.
author: TimOfAltona

text: I mean, it's just not on, all these people saved by the current government. The sooner we get the Labor/Greens back running things the sooner the boats can start up again and we all know what follows.
author: TimOfAltona

text: That said, you also know that Abbott is not my ideal choice to take us to the next election, but if Shorten does not lift his game soon, Abbott will probably win quite easily.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Barry cassidy asked that question of Richard Marles on Insiders yeaterday and guess what - Marles danced around the question and utteered something along the lines that labor will maintain secure borders as well. No detail whatsoever. There is a good reason for that - Labor have no f*cking idea what they will do about border protection, offshore detention and stopping he boats.
author: TimOfAltona

text: You are right - Labor came out of Episode 1 pretty well, particularly Rudd and his efforts during the GFC. Not so much MT and Godwin Grech affair - won't make that silly mistake again will he?
author: TimOfAltona

text: Best you give us the link that shows the government supports the rape of children - you hear outlandish claims in these threads but some like this one are just bizarre.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Here's a tip for you - Labor did in fact bring alot of it's misfortune on itself during the Rudd/Gillard/Rudd years - it was not the media that made Labor dysfunctional. They did it all on their own.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Better pass that on to your brethren down at the ALP ...all they want to talk about is how they failed on boats...boats, boats, boats, that's all we here from labor these days.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Burke is just digging a deeper hole for the ALP. These accusations do nothing more than reconfirm in voters mind that Labor were responsible for starting the boats, giving the people smugglers an ideal business model and 1000+ people lured to their deaths.
author: TimOfAltona

text: A few thousand more votes going to the LNP over the past few days as we witness Labor and the Greens demonstrate they have no idea how to stop the boats and only to happy to see the whole thing start up again if they ever should be returned to government in this country.
author: TimOfAltona

text: They just don't seem to be able to understand/comprehend that if you flout the standing orders, get warned once, continue acting up, get warned twice, keep acting up, get warned a third time and then get thrown out then they only have themselves to blame.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Right here is why the court of public opinion is right behind the government on this issue. The Labor/Greens cheer squads' interpretation of what these boats are is so far out of whack with the rest of Australia they lost this battle years ago.
author: TimOfAltona

text: The people smugglers are intent on finding a new market to start up their deadly operations - this time NZ. In the highly unlikely event the boat made it to NZ standby and watch hundreds of boats set sail for NZ and the risk of drownings multiplied because of the distance.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Corrupt Indonesian officials, police, military, local government have been turning a blind eye to people smuggling activities for years...hell sometimes they even drive the customers down to the port and waive the boats off as they head towards Australia - all for a cut of the action.
author: TimOfAltona

text: He just could not bring himself to admit Abbott's government had done a great job in shutting down the people smugglers, stopping the boats and importantly stopping the drownings.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Things are grim for the ALP when that doyen of the Labor Party, Michael Costa, starts questioning Shorten's credibility. The slow death of the modern day Labor Party continues unabated.
author: TimOfAltona

text: All Australian governments,Liberal and Labor, have looked the other way over West Papua - putting trade ahead of the genocide occuring right on our door step. I'm often critical of the Greens, but I support them on West Papua and congratulate them as the only political party in Australia who regularly and actively call Indonesia out on West Papua.
author: TimOfAltona

Expect to see Euro governments start to take a much harder line with people smugglers out of Nth Africa.

text: She was wheeled in to try and prop up a failing Labor government after the shambles that were the John Cain years and try as she might her two short years as Premier was marked by incompetence in managing the state's financial affairs (the Labor Way we have come to know). Her failure to cut spending and addicted to borrowing soon saw the state's interest bill skyrocket to billions of dollars a year.

text: There are parallels with her government and that of Julia Gillard - both women were wheeled in to try and reverse a very sick and sorry labor party and both women failed dismally and lead their parties to landslide defeats, Gillard indirectly.

LOL.

There are processes to achieve this which are owned by the government of the day and will ensure passage goes through. Shorten & Plibersek are playing wedge politics pure and simple.

text: It's almost as if the recalcitrant Labor mob see some kind of status or honour in being thrown out on a regular basis - perhaps there are bets on to see who can get thrown out the most, either way not a good look for them and they are not doing their constituents any good by being repeatedly ejected from the chamber.

text: I'm with you - Labor need to stop acting like primary school children and return a little decorum to the place. We know they are on the back foot but they don't need to compensate for that by acting up in parliament QT.

text: Here's a hint for you - the minister does not determine whether a person is stripped of dual nationality by reading tea leaves at the bottom of a cup or even off the back of a corn flakes box - perhaps that is the Labor way, but in this case the minister is advised by all the government intelligence agencies involved in determining a person's activity/status and what activities they have been engaged in which have the potential to remove their Australian citizenship. Sometimes you just have to trust the government we elected to guard the security of this nation.
author: TimOfAltona

text: In fact Daisy is a very good example of why the ALP are losing ground...refuses to listen to any criticism or acknowledge there is a problem and thinks all they have to do is focus on Abbott and they will sneak into government.

text: The bigger story sitting in this article is that Labor continue to lose more ground....no surprises there.....it was clear as day that after the civil war raging during the Rudd/Gillard/Rudd years tearing the party apart and the subsequent 2013 thrashing handed out by the electorate, that Labor needed a major overhaul and rebuild to win back the trust and support of not only it's traditional blue collar supporter base but also middle Australia.

text: The right install their man against the wishes of party members who overwhelmingly backed another candidate and the bloke installed, who carries more baggage than a Samsonite trade fair, just sits on his hands firing off the odd inane zinger in the general direction of the government and hopes an unpopular PM will be his passport to slip into the Lodge in 2016 just by being there.

text: In my view Labor's rebuilding has barely begun.....I suspect the national conference will expose some old wounds and perhaps publicly reignite the simmering tension between left and right...but it should be used as a platform to firstly recognise that federal Labor today is largely unelectable and that sitting around hoping that a seemingly unpopular PM and Green preferences is not enough to get them back into government.

text: Reality is, despite the polls which provide false hope (as they did in the UK recently), the LNP are on track to remain in government for another term, with or without Abbott as leader and for good reason.

text: You are entitled to your opinion, just as much as I am, and in my opinion you occupy a minority grouping over this issue. The world are looking to Australia for guidance on how to stop thousands of people drowning in the oceans.

text: The answer is simple - remove the people smugglers business model which stops the boats and the drownings cease. Fairly simple equation, lost on the anti-Abbott brigade that loiter in these threads hoping for support from other members of their minority group.

text: The people smugglers must be just hanging out hoping another weak and indecisive Labor/Greens government somehow falls across the line and gives them back their business model to restart their lucrative yet deadly trade.

text: An LA based friend of mine in the industry often used to lament that when she hit 30 the roles & offers started to dry up noticeably. She had been quite active in both TV and movie roles up 'till then.

text: We are yet to hear from just one of the 'Abbott is evil' and 'Let 'em all come here' cheer squad explain what we should do after we take the current boat loads of asylum seekers and then the next wave of boats appear, followed by the next wave, followed by the next wave and the next and the next and the next and the next in perpetuity.....for that is what you will be starting by giving the people smugglers a product to sell and also allowing people smugglers to dictate our immigration policy (as Labor allowed them to do under Rudd and Gillard) not to mention the thousands who may tragically drown along the way all because Australia put the sugar out on the table.

text: Also, you need to factor in the billions of dollars it will cost the economy to support taking in the hundreds of thousands of asylum seekers trying to get to Australia.

text: I think what many in the Labor/Greens cheer squad don't understand is that as soon as Australia starts offering transport and settlement in Australia for these refugees, hey presto, the people smugglers are provided with a viable business model and the flood gates open, encouraging thousands more to take to leaky boats hoping they too can end up in Australia. Many more drownings result.

text: We already witnessed this when the Rudd Labor government gave the people smugglers a viable operating business model out of Indonesia and we all know the result of that little disaster - the current government is still trying to deal with it.

text: It's a good thing to have a diversity of opinion within a government - provided it's a positive contribution, which Sharman Stone and Arthur Sinodinos comments are. They assist shape policy and ideas.

text: Nothing wrong whatsoever in Abbott's comments - there is plenty of dead wood in the ranks of the long term unemployed...no employer wants to be saddled with a hopeless/deadshit employee.... at least this gives the employee a month to demonstrate they are capable of fulfilling the role for which they will be paid and also satisfy the employer they are worthy of being retained. A win-win at any examination.

text: Your response is a beautiful example of why federal Labor will fail for years to come - ignoring the 'elephants in the room' and pretending everything is hunky dory will only see Labor amble along, going no where and continue to lose support from it's traditional base.

text: The huge elephant in the room is Labor's position on people smuggling and asylum seekers. As far as you can make out through the smoke screens, Shorten is basically saying 'me too' when it comes to dealing with this issue, in that he supports the governments efforts to stamp out the trade. At some point voters will expect Labor to provide a comprehensive statement/policy (costed of course) as to how Labor will deal with this issue if they were to return to government. Until Labor shows its hand on this topic, you can forget any opinion polls that show Labor ahead.

text: In my view, Labors greatest error in judgement over the past year has been to sit back, adopt a small target strategy and hope and pray they can win back office off the back of an unpopular PM just by 'being there'.

text: Labor need to ditch Shorten and Plibersek (they are the 'old' Labor left over from the disaster for Labor that were the Rudd/Gillard/Rudd years) as they carry far too much negative baggage.

text: Not too many fitted machine guns on the two boats donated to Malaysia that I can see - perhaps just a figment of your imagination comrade?  are important here.

text: Nothing gets the Labor/Greens cheer squad frothing at the mouth more than a Guardian headline that contains the words 'Boats' & 'Abbott'.....I suspect this is because this is a key electoral issue and very likely to keep Labor and the Greens out of government for years to come....that aside, extending the often hysterical hyperbole to include linking migrant smuggler boats leaving ports all around the world to Tony Abbott is at best fanciful and at worst a little unhinged IMHO.

text: That's a new one from the cheer squad - the Australian government is now responsible for the actions of all other countries who take steps to stamp out people smuggling and stop mass drownings at sea and any loss of life is all down to Tony Abbott.

text: The left lost this argument a long time ago and were thrashed at the last election partly because Labor screwed up big time and could not be trusted to deal with this issue. Nothing much has changed.

text: The Labor/Greens cheer squad would be wise to remember that they will never be returned to government in this country while they promote giving people smugglers their insidious business model back. Just the way it is IMHO.

As effective as this government is, it has no influence with boats departing Burma nor North Africa for that matter, as much as some of the more unhinged Labor/Greens cheer squad are trying, blaming Tony Abbott for the drownings in the Med is a little bizarre IMHO.

text: I'm confused...if he did nothing you will mercilessly attack for doing nothing and when he actually takes concrete steps to protect the reef you mercilessly attack him for taking action to protect the reef...anyone else confused?

text: Just between you and me Daisy it is not only the Liberal Party gearing up to get the boot into Shorten.....the left of the Labor Party are lining up to insert the proverbial knife in the back.....along with most Australian voters if he is still leader come the next federal election.

text: Yep, NSW is a fine example of which you speak. The tide is turning...people remember what it is like under Labor - NSW woke up and rejected the inept ALP....the same thing will happen federally.

text: Forget pro-LNP Textor - if Labor were good enough they can win...herein lies your problem...the ALP are years away from reform and rebuilding themselves into a viable alternative government...until they do no amount of spin from the ALP factions will work...it is  that's needed and this is where Labor fall over time and time again.

text: The challenge Labor had after the drubbing in Sept 2013 was to rebuild, re-invigorate, sort out dysfunctional and factional leadership wars and sort out if they are in or out of bed with the Greens and also distance themselves from Trades Hall to appeal to more mainstream voters.

text: The reality is that it will always ever be the two major parties governing the country, although Labor have form when it comes to selling their soul to the Greens for political expediency...but even the Greens can't save Labor in the foreseeable future.

text: Nothing like the words 'US Military', ''B1 Bomber' and 'Abbott' in a headline to get the red neck Labor/Greens supporters lighting their flaming torches, grabbing their pitchforks, constructing their Abbott/US Flag effigies and marching towards the gates of parliament en masse.

text: Shorten's speech (we await to discover who wrote it for him) was predictable as it was desperate. Desperate because Labor have been wedged beautifully......the government had the audacity to present the kind of budget only a Labor government could have produced and it has the ALP rattled.

text: You only have to look at the polling in the UK to prove that polls mean jack shit - the only poll that counts is on election day (to borrow a well used phrase)

text: The ALP are deluding themselves if they think all they have to do is 'be there' to win an election. Won't happen and they will be thrashed just as UK Labour were last week.
