text: Australia's worst bush fires since European settlement occurred in the 19th century. The largest bush fire was in Victoria in 1851 where a quarter of the state of Victoria, 5 million hectares, went up in flames with the total loss of life of 12 people! Not sure there was too much global warming going on in the 1800's.
author: TimOfAltona

text: I strongly suspect that even the most optimistic Labor supporters in these threads, though they will never admit it, are feeling more than a little nervous about this new Labor lineup.

text: Labor's problem is that the lineup you see today will look quite different in 24 months time once the usual dysfunction, leadership squabbles and internal division kicks in.

text: Most of these lightweights will crash and burn over the next few years and we will see the good old Labor party front bench musical chairs we came to know so well under Gillard and Rudd.

text: The point you miss is that Australia's population was a fraction n the 1800's of where it is today and also back then there was not the migration of communities into the bush fire prone areas that we have today (man meets bush).

text: Had that been the case the major fires in the 1800's would very likely have claimed the same number of lives or more that we see much smaller fires today.

text: Many of the commentators on here seem to have got themselves a bit confused or muddled up in the heat of the debate - Abbott has never said climate change is not real - he has said it is real and it's happening and that it is a man made phenomena.

text: Now that we have that straight - it is the Coalition's path to addressing the problem that a) they went to an election on and won with a 35 seat majority and b) may differ from the views of some on here (who want a price on carbon) that seems to challenge the minds of the Labor/Greens cheer squad.

text: Constant streams of abuse and vilification hurled at PM Tony Abbott achieves nothing.It will not morph the government into Labor overnight, it will not bring on another election and it will not fix the crippling internal problems of Labor by making them miraculously disappear.

text: There is some validity to Tony Abbott's remarks. Bush fires have always and will always be a part of the Australian landscape - many of the largest fires recorded since European settlement were in the 1800's. Not sure there was too much global warming going on in 1857? (Australia's largest ever recorded bush fire).

text: Unfortunately you have managed to get yourself all muddled up and confused. There was no media present when Abbott was out for 14 hours with the fire crews doing back burning work.

text: It's pretty clear you are just itching to come right out and say these fires are Tony Abbott's fault. text: Thankfully we no longer have a government dictated or controlled by the unions (rife when Gillard was PM) and the Coalition will weigh up all options without digging our debt hole deeper.

text: What happened was both the Coalition and Labor were put up for examination by the Australian voting public and Labor were found to be sorely wanting and were thrown out by voters. The voters liked what they saw in the Coalition and everything stacked up and they were easily voted in - something like 90 seats to Labor's 55.

text: Seems the majority of Australians are very happy with the way the new PM and government are performing and also think Labor are still going backwards. Perhaps they are right.

text: Always good to see the government following through on policies it took to the election. The audit commission was a key Coalition policy and following a resounding election win, they are following through on their promises.

text: It seems a small number of people on these threads may not have voted for the Coalition and are still coming to terms with the ALP's crushing defeat, however for the majority of us who voted for the Coalition it is comforting to know we at last have a competent government running the show and delivering on key promises.

text: I think you may have got yourself a little confused over this article - pretending that these practices did not occur while Labor were in government for 6 years and suggesting that this is all to do with the Coalition points to your total bias and irrelevancy to the debate.
author: TimOfAltona

text: To the contrary, good to see the government on top of things and following through on the promises they made before the election - the promises we voted them in to enact.
author: TimOfAltona

text: It takes some time to sort out the fiscal and policy mess left behind after 6 years of Labor mismanagement - the task is perhaps larger than we all envisaged - but the majority of Australians have great faith in this government to deliver.
author: TimOfAltona

text: With a little less than 3 years to go before the next Coalition government is sworn in, it's good to see so many people with positive impressions of the Coalition leadership team.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Would be interesting to do the same research on the ALP - suspect they would only have 3 or 4 shadow ministers that anyone has heard of - the rest are invisible. Is Shorten still the leader?
author: TimOfAltona

text: Smart move by the PM. Good thing Labor have been thrown out and we have responsible economic management under the Coalition. They will eventually get on top of 6 years of massive Labor debt.
author: TimOfAltona

text: A code of conduct for the Labor/Greens cheer squad would be more fitting - have you read some of the comments they post on here? Those that make it through without being deleted by the moderator I mean.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Not an unreasonable request at all. Most large companies in Australia have a code of conduct which new employees are required to acknowledge and sign as part of the recruitment process - covers workplace behaviour, company regulations etc etc.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Abbott to his credit has publicly stated that mankind is influencing climate change and that steps do need to be taken - it's the path we take that is in contention.
author: TimOfAltona

text: This issue has already brought down 2 or 3 Labor PM's in recent times (depending on your view) and one conservative LOTO - a tough challenge for any government - Labor or Liberal.
author: TimOfAltona

text: The Australian Labor cheer squad on here have no issue with Rupert Murdoch, they actually think he is an accomplished Australian (albeit he is also a US citizen), they admire his acumen and his success on the world stage.
author: TimOfAltona

text: The part they do not like is that Murdoch was not backing their team in the last Australian Federal Election - Murdoch chose to back the current Australian PM and the Labor cheer squad can't stand it. For them it's payback time so they expend all their energy in denigrating Murdoch at each and every opportunity. They like to apportion blame for Labor's dismal performance and dysfunctionality on News Ltd - a confected smokescreen to camouflage Labor's inherent inadequacies.
author: TimOfAltona

text: The irony is, that had Murdoch backed Rudd and the ALP, all these Labor cheer squad commentators would either be silent in threads relating to Murdoch or they would be praising and supporting him as a great Australian who is unfairly judged by others.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Newsflash! Many thousands of middle aged Australians have grown up children living and working in Europe - Thousands of these people enjoy visiting their children during the holiday break. No surprises there.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Actually Pat, I think you'll find that the only 'outrage' generated is within a handful of Labor supporters in the Guardian thread. The submission itself is not nearly as bad as the Labor people would have you believe - there are safeguards proposed - these have been ignored by the commentators in this thread to suit their own political bias.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Also, you mention 'no surprises' - well this GP submission is in keeping with that position - it is canvassing opinion ahead of any government action - it may or may not go ahead from here, but at any examination I fail to see how the government can be accused of putting up legislation without consultation - it is doing exactly what any elected government should be doing as it goes about the business of governing.
author: TimOfAltona

text: How this GP report has any correlation with what you are asserting beats me. The comments emanating from the handful of Labor/Greens supporters are bordering on hysteria in the extreme.
author: TimOfAltona

text: You guys are hopeless - this only a report, it is not govt policy, I doubt that Abbott would even be aware of it - yet you are all carrying on like Abbott authored it and it has been legislated.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Your hysteria over this is laughable. Have you even read the report or are you just going along with the lies and deception of a handful of Labor/Greens commentators on here.?
author: TimOfAltona

text: You have got yourself all muddled up - pensioners are not paying for it, nor are health card holders. It is only a paper for discussion at this stage.
author: TimOfAltona

text: The only 'fears' are in the minds of Labor supporters such as yourself - the majority of people have no issue. There are plenty of protections for pensioners and health card people - it does not affect them and the $5 payment kicks in only after 12 visits to the doctor, and this is only a proposal. 'Chippendale' conveniently ignores all the facts of this matter as he usually does.
author: TimOfAltona

text: All the Labor cheer squad are calling for this to be a one term Abbott government - yet not one of them are proposing who should replace the Abbott government.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Can I suggest that once the carbon tax is removed there will be more than enough savings to offset any potential visit to a doctor - not wanting to demean your argument - but you will find that electricity bills will reduce which will be of great assistance to the very people you mention.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Unfortunately for you and so many other of the Labor cheer squad you have completely misinterpreted what is going on - pensioners are exempt - so there's no point in carrying on about pensioners being hit hard.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Good to see the government taking additional steps to reverse Labor's tragic economic management....measures had to be taken and this suggestion/proposal is not a large impost and I see pensioners/health card holders are exempt anyway.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Peta Credlin has done an admirable job as the PM's Chief of Staff. Probably the most accomplished CoS for many years. Not sure why the Labor/Greens cheer squad fear her so much - perhaps it's because she was a key player in the removal of the former failed ALP government?
author: TimOfAltona

text: Your Labor bias has you all confused over this issue - it was the Ambassador who went to the media to broadcast her intentions hoping it would assist her case - Morrison is merely responding, as would any other Immigration Minister.
author: TimOfAltona

text: All Morrison is doing here is expressing what any Immigration Minister would be doing under these circumstances, yet the usual grubby comments emerge from a handful of people who are yet to concede that the hapless ALP were beaten by a better side last election.
author: TimOfAltona

text: I think we all agree that the Immigration Minister portfolio is one of the toughest around - just look at how many successive Immigration Minster's there were in the Rudd/Gillard/Rudd years.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Morrison is doing a good job under difficult circumstances - when you peel back the white noise emanating from the Labor/Greens cheer squad in the Guardian threads - the Coalition are actually reducing the number of boat arrivals and consequently the deaths at sea.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Morrison should be congratulated and is congratulated for his efforts in combating people smugglers - this is why the people of Australia flicked a dysfunctional and incompetent Labor government and installed a Coalition government to fix the problem - and don't the Labor cheer squad hate his success!!
author: TimOfAltona

text: The Labor/Greens cheer squad commenting on this need to come clean - it matters not which decision Scott Morrison makes on this issue, they will conjure up some grubby comments condemning the outcome - either way.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Youare wrong and you clearly missed the Fact Check on this issue - don't worry, the rest of the Labor/Greens cheer squad did too - so to assist you I will post the link to the Fact Checker piece which concludes that Morrison is correct in his terminology - here is the conclusion cut and paste -
author: TimOfAltona

text:
The verdict 
Mr Morrison is correct. 
Based on the definition set out in the people smuggling protocol, people who have come to Australia without a valid visa have illegally entered the country. 
That is the case even though these people have not committed any crime, nor broken any Australian or international law.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Exactly. The Labor/Greens cheer squad see it very differently - their strong preference is for the boats to keep arriving - it allows them to continue their vilification of the government.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Funny how so many of the comments on here are actually supporting the activities of people smugglers - the Labor/Greens cheer squad are actually barracking for the people smugglers to keep the boats coming - they dread the thought that the Coalition may actually be successful in reducing the numbers of boat arrivals - such an outcome would make the Coalition look good and confirm what we all knew about Labor's incompetence.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Good on Morrison for doing exactly what we voted this government in to do - stopping the boats and the associated deaths and misery that accompanies the people smugglers vile trade.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Don't the Labor/Greens cheer squad just hate it when the boats stop arriving - they just hate it - they want as many boats as possible to keep arriving - makes them feel all good inside to think that the Coalition may be as terrible as Labor were in stopping the boats.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Labor cheer squad will insist that they are not in a coalition with the Greens so we subtract The Greens vote and we end up with Labor at 4,311,398 votes vs the Coalition at 5,882,904.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Just because you don't like Abbott and could never bring yourself to acknowledge some of the good work he is doing, there is no need to attack Mundine's integrity and intelligence.
author: TimOfAltona

text: It's not Albo's fault - it's just that the ALP don't know what they stand for any more, all they can do is oppose for the sake of opposing. It's a great smokescreen to hide their inherent inadequacies.
author: TimOfAltona

text: This guy deliberately broke Russian law and knew the consequences would be imprisonment - yet he expects the Aussie government to bail him out of trouble when he did in fact get arrested.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Can't wait for the betting agencies to open up the Griffith by-election. All the Labor/Greens cheer squad are pontificating on how Glasson will be beaten by Labor hands down.

text: Toxic Labor are so on the nose in QLD (and elsewhere) - you only have to look at the odds for an LNP victory in the next QLD state election - LNP $1.20 Labor $3.90.

text: You didn't answer my question - in fact you completed averted your answer away from who will be the Labor leader to end Tony Abbott's government at the next election.

text: Pal, you know as well as every other reader on here that this government has been in power for 5 minutes vs the 6 long years we endured the failed Labor experiment.
author: TimOfAltona

text: The Labor cheer squad want to see all this delivered in the first month of a Coalition government. Sit tight, hold on and enjoy the ride for the next 9+ years. It will only improve and your opinion will alter with time.

text: No doubt the NZ Labour Party and Council of Trade Unions will disagree, but I suspect John Key will go down in the history books as being one of NZ's great reforming PMs.

text: Here's a tip - a handful of vengeful comments will not return the ALP to government any time soon - the Coalition are in government for the many years ahead.

text: Get used to the idea and perhaps if you start supporting the government's initiatives instead of trying to blindly tear everything down you may start feeling a bit better about yourselves.

text: The Labor cheer squad are very busy posting vengeful comments aimed at the PM and the government - funny thing is not one of them are proposing which politician or for that matter which party are best equipped to replace Abbott when he eventually steps down.

text: Well knock me over with a feather - a Greens spokesperson with hollow accusations is critical of the government ....why does the Guardian even report this stuff - must be an extremely slow news day.

text: David , I wish I had a dollar for every person who has written that Abbott won't last in the role, won't make it to the end of the year, won't make it to the election etc etc - yet not one person has proposed a) who would replace him if in fact he did go and b) who will be the leader of the ALP when we do eventually go to the polls in 2016/17?
author: TimOfAltona

text: The government's key objective is to make using people smugglers' boats as a means to get to Australia as unattractive as possible - disrupt their business model so people stop paying them for a service they can't possibly deliver.
author: TimOfAltona

text: A number of tactics need to be deployed to achieve this disruption - turning boats around where it is safe to do so is one of a myriad of tactics, along with stopping the flow of information back to the people smugglers.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Morrison needs to be given some clear air to implement and apply the tactics - he is having some success thus far and certainly the frequency of departures and number of drownings have significantly reduced as a result.
author: TimOfAltona

text: l, you are a bit confused over this - they have been successful in both dramatically reducing the volume of boast arrivals and have been busy delivering on their pre-election tactic of turning boats around where it is safe to do so.
author: TimOfAltona

text: I know it pains Labor supporters to see how an effective government works but get used to it - a little less than 3 years to go before the next Coalition government are sworn in!
author: TimOfAltona

text: I have a suggestion for all the Labor/Greens cheer squad on here who so desperately want to see the boats keep departing Indonesia - why not actually support the government's actions in trying to prevent people getting on dangerous and leaky boats and attempting to reach Australia?
author: TimOfAltona

text: Is this not preferable to blindly attacking the government for trying to 'stop the boats' - people actually think you are in favor of people coming to Australia via boats from Indonesia and that you support the people smuggling activity.
author: TimOfAltona

text: 'Stop the boats' was a central plank of the Coalition's election promises - one that saw Labor lose government - therefore it's up to the cheer squad to attack any government initiative that actually delivers on that promise - they want it to fail so they can claim a 'victory' over the party that threw them out of government.
author: TimOfAltona

text: If asylum seekers want to post on a Guardian thread nothing is stopping them. I'm guessing your real name is not Brisco Rant (but I could be mistaken) so there is nothing to stop someone posting under a nom de plume as 99% of contributors do.

text: Good news for all gay Pakistanis - Alan Freeman has decreed that you are all entitled to relocate to Australia forthwith, including your families, and settle here for the remainder of your lives at Australian taxpayers expense.

text: Looking at many of the comments below, one would be excused for thinking that the Labor supporters here are very keen to see the boats arriving on our shores - the more the better.

text: They want the government's border protection policies to fail - the people to keep flooding in and the odd drowning or two along the way wouldn't do any harm either.
author: TimOfAltona

text: So, I take it you are in favour of an open borders policy? Just let anyone everyone who wants to come to Australia by any means possible free passage into the country?
author: TimOfAltona

text: There are tens of millions of displaced persons around the globe - you want them all to come to Australia if they can find a way to come here with no restrictions whatsoever?

text: By my reckoning we have roughly another 3 years to go before the next Coalition government is sworn in. The odds of Abbott entering the 2nd term as PM are very good. The betting agencies certainly have him as outright favourite.

text: Quite a story. Surprised you can keep a sense of humor after an experience like that. Sounds like it all worked out in the end and your story graphically highlights the importance of recognizing the warning signs early on and acting on it - though no one would wish your experience on anyone.
author: TimOfAltona

text: You may be right - the Labor/Greens coalition will probably see the seat retained by the ALP - makes no difference to anything at all apart from giving the Labor/Greens cheer squad some forlorn hope that the ALP may be back in federal government in 9 years or so.

text: Glasson will make a fine member for Griffith and best of all, there will be another vacant green seat on the Labor side of the house, - looks a bit lonely and desolate over that side of the house for hapless Labor.

text: Will be interesting to see who Labor send up there to try and show some support for the Labor left candidate - will it be good ol' Electricity Bill? Perhaps it should he needs a bit of exposure given no-one really knows if he is still Labor leader or not.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Glasson will make a fine MP for Griffith - did a really good job of taking the fight right up to the last failed Labor PM (Rudd I mean, not Gillard) who had the seat.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Look at all the Labor/Greens cheer squad trying desperately to link Bernadi's views and opinions to the government - if there is no link they will fabricate one anyway.
author: TimOfAltona

text: There is no link - Bernardi's views right or wrong, are not the views of the government - as much as you really really want them to be to suit you're own bitter and twisted anti-government agenda.
author: TimOfAltona

text: You seem to have an amazing insight into the machinations of the LNP - you seem to know more about what Tony Abbott, Peta Credlin or Cory Bernardi think than they do themselves.
author: TimOfAltona

text: With such acute psychic powers perhaps you could join the Liberal Party, attend your local branch meetings and assist the PM and the party steer us all through the next few years of Coalition government.
author: TimOfAltona

text: I see many UK readers have contributed to this story and by and large are supporting the actions of this PM and government in stopping the flood of people arriving illegally by boat into Australia.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Tony Abbott made border protection a central plank in his election campaign late last year - it was a very big issue and the problem had been compounded when the previous Labor PM and government relaxed the immigration laws which saw tens of thousands of people making their way to Australia by leaky boats courtesy of people smugglers and corrupt Indonesian officials, resulting in 1000+ drownings at sea and billions of dollars of extra cost to the Australian tax payer.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Ever since the conservatives have been in government, the Labour supporters have been attacking every move the government has made to prevent boats departing Indonesia. The Labor supporters desperately want the government's policy to fail as a direct payback for Labor's election loss.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Crazy at may seem, many of them are very happy to see more and more boat loads of people arrive so they support the people smugglers' activities and denounce government measures to stop them.
author: TimOfAltona

text: It seems to provide them with some kind of twisted satisfaction so they can claim that the conservatives won government on a lie by being unable to stop the boats.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Make no mistake - the majority of Australian's are supportive of what the government are doing to prevent boats leaving Indonesia and therefore drownings at sea - the handful of disaffected Labor supporters who flock to the Guardian threads to attack the government for simply following through on what they promised to do before the election are in the minority and are pretty much irrelevant in the bigger picture.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Their biggest fear is that the conservative government will be successful with it's intention to 'stop the boats' and will go on to have another decisive victory in the 2016 election.
author: TimOfAltona

text: I see your point re IAG - the QF/BA association goes back a long way - however I doubt if IAG would have the financial backing to take a majority shareholding in QF - the middle eastern airlines have the deepest pockets by far - with Emirates and Etihad at the top of the tree.
author: TimOfAltona

text: This sorry tale all goes back to a Qantas Board decision to replace Qantas CEO Geoff Dixon with the European budget airline Alan Joyce and overlook John Borghetti who received neither a fair hearing of even a proper interview for the role and promptly exited the airline.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Joyce had a fixation on building up low cost Jetstar to the detriment of full service Qantas and after years of mis-management, poor decisions and IR debacles, Qantas is now a shadow of its former self and the whole house of cards is in danger of collapsing.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Meanwhile Borghetti has gone on and turned Virgin around to be a strong contender for the preferred airline for corporate Australia (the highest yielding fares) and is killing Qantas on some domestic routes - acquisition of Tiger Australia will also assist Virgin inflict further damage on Qantas/Jetstar.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Add to that a nice bit of joint marketing/partnership/codeshare with Borghetti's mate James Hogan from Etihad and suddenly Virgin have a very effective international network to exploit for both corporate and leisure travel.
author: TimOfAltona

text: The blame for this debacle sits with the QF Board and they should be the ones wearing the fallout over this, along with Joyce who simply cannot survive given the results and the turmoil at QF since he's been in the chair.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Probably deferred. There is enough pressure on business with other taxes,penalties and on costs to contend with, particularly for small business. Higher the minimum wage, the less incentive for small business to place additional staff or they start putting staff off to keep the business viable, unemployment increases.
author: TimOfAltona

text: It should be noted that it is the award wages which spelled the end of car manufacturing in this country...all going offshore to India, China and Thailand. The unions have made a massive contribution to this sad outcome by relentlessly pushing up wages over the years. Now it's all but over. Great work ACTU.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Shorten, like Gillard, is a puppet of the Trade Union movement. Of course he is going to trumpet the ACTU agenda - he has to or he loses their support and in turn the Labor leadership - just like Gillard and Rudd before him.
author: TimOfAltona

text: No you have it all mixed up - it was the Labor government that was the failure, the media called it as it was - a failure, and now we have a new Coalition in government for the next decade or so.
author: TimOfAltona

text: I have absolutely no issue with (genuine) asylum seekers whatsoever. I wish them the very best to improve their situation and if that involves Australia then I hope that they one day can enter the country through the UNHCR channels established to handle those cases.
author: TimOfAltona

text: What I loath and detest are the people smugglers who prey on the vulnerable and are making a fortune (many of these guys have become millionaires many times over since Rudd opened up the borders in 2007) by trading in human cargo over dangerous oceans with no regard for the safety or well being of the men, women and children on board. I add that a % of these 'asylum' seekers are no doubt economic migrants trying to improve their wealth by coming to Australia with no real threat back home whatsoever.
author: TimOfAltona

text: The Abbott government, just like the Labor government before, are trying to shut down the people smugglers operation by making it as unattractive as possible to board an illegal boat in Indonesia and attempting the journey to Australia. Abbott and Morrison are doing all they can to put the people smugglers out of business.
author: TimOfAltona

text: 1)The widespread corruption amongst Indonesian police, military and local government officials who are on the smugglers payroll;2) the politics in Indonesia where the general elections are only six months off and there is a lot of chest beating going on by government and opposition parties on who is standing up more to Australia on this issue3) The Greens back in Australia and the Labor supporters who desperately want any government initiatives to fail so they can claim some sort of 'victory' over the coalition as payback for the election loss.
author: TimOfAltona

text: No you are all confused - that was Julia Gillard's earpiece tuned into John McTernan's smart phone - he was actually reading the script out to her and she was repeating it word for word. This was happening for months.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Not sure what point Lenore is attempting to make here - the PM was on radio answering questions from a journalist. It seems the journalist did not ask the questions Lenore may have asked had she had the opportunity to interview the PM.

text: Last time I looked Tony Abbott is the PM of this country and is perfectly within his rights to voice an opinion against alcohol fuelled violence as we would expect any PM to do.

text: Well one thing recent history has taught us is that relaxing the rules leads to a free for all and apart from thousands arriving on our shores, hundreds if not thousands of the poor souls drowned.

text: I reckon it would be a good thing for Labor supporters to get in behind the government and show some support instead of attacking every move they take to thwart the people smuggler operation - unless of course they want to see the boats keep arriving.

text: However a sovereign country has a right to protect it's borders from uncontrolled immigration - uncontrolled immigration provides the people smugglers with a huge incentive to expand their operation which will lead to tens of thousands more people turning up on our shores outside the UNHCR process and in turn perhaps hundreds or thousands of more drownings at sea.

text: Your melodrama is quite becoming but wholly unbelievable - no one believes you for a moment that our defence forces are shooting at defenceless refugees. Be careful Chippendale, the relevancy of your posts is under question and rightly so.

text: Read the article - you are talking nonsense and making it up as you go along. You've been sucked in by the people smugglers who gain from this kind of bullshit.

text: Come clean Mark - you informed everyone that you would no longer be commenting in Guardian threads due to the stress of having to read views opposed to your own.

text: Yep, we can't be having the government actually stopping the boats can we? That would mean they would be fulfilling an election promise and will probably get them reelected in 2016.

text: He can't possibly deny this happened and it not to leak out - with the dozens of naval men and women at the scene, the visual recording of the event from the bridge of the naval vessel and the camera phones recording this from the asylum seeker boat it would be leaked very quickly if it happened.

text: The same people who told us about shots being fired are also telling us about an unseaworthy boat...you gotta stop being sucked in by propaganda designed to benefit the people smugglers operation.
author: TimOfAltona

text: A pissed off asylum seeker who was returned to Indonesia after paying a people smuggler thousands of dollars and an Indonesian policeman who gets paid to wave the asylum seeker boats off from his shore are definitely telling us the truth.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Wow, how quickly the Labor/Greens supporters were sucked in by a lying asylum seeker who didn't make it to Australia in cohorts with an Indonesian policeman who most likely profits from the boats leaving his area.
author: TimOfAltona

text: You shouldn't allow yourself to be sucked in so quickly by lying asylum seekers who didn't make it to Australia and Indonesian policemen who profit from the boats departing.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Why would Morrison deny that it happened if it did - how many witnesses from the RAN and the people smugglers boat would there have been as well as video from the RAN of the incident?
author: TimOfAltona

text: So here we have an anonymous disaffected asylum seeker telling an anonymous Indonesian police 'chief' that a certain event took place and hey presto the left swarm all over it in full support of the anonymous asylum seeker's story because it gives them ammunition, no matter how dubious, to attack the government.
author: TimOfAltona

text: The message to people smugglers is clear - the Australian border is CLOSED to the smuggling of men, women and children via leaky boats - they will be stopped and turned around - it's not the ALP you are dealing with anymore.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Hey Santos, I just gave you a recommend - you deserve it for all the trouble you went to in responding to me, totally superfluous to what I was saying, but well done for a fine effort anyway.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Well of course Tim Flannery is going to say that and of course the Greens will jump in along side him and of course the Labor supporters will jump in behind the Greens as they tend to do.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Now let's hear from the experts who will tell us that Australia has been experiencing wide ranging climatic variations for millions of years and that man, whilst making a modest contribution to changing weather patterns which rightly should be addressed, are no where near as culpable as many alarmists make out.
author: TimOfAltona

text: It could be another 200 years before Victoria experiences another 'record' hot spell - after all the last one was over 100 years ago and hotter than this current one.
author: TimOfAltona

text: The over riding challenge for both Labor and the Coalition has always been how to overcome the widespread corruption in Indonesia that allows the people smuggling trade to flourish - numerous police, military and government officials are all caught up in it and profiteering from the people smuggling operations.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Occasionally the SBY government arrest one or two officials and charge them with corruption relating to people smugglers but this is only window dressing to make it appear they are on top of it.
author: TimOfAltona

text: He won't be taking the grubby comments and childish name calling from the Labor/Greens people personally because any Coalition Minister with that portfolio will be copping personal attacks from the Labor/Greens pom pom shakers.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Funny how all these people were non-critical when Labor introduced severe border protection measures when the McTernan/Gillard government panicked on the back of public opinion and later by Rudd when he went further than the Coalition in order to stave off electoral annihilation?
author: TimOfAltona

text: When people obviously from the left post disingenuous comments like "I'm a swinging voter but could never bring myself to support Abbott" the bullshit barometer goes right off the richter scale.
author: TimOfAltona

text: so...I take it then that you support the activities of the people smugglers and you think the government should leave them alone and allow boats to freely depart Indonesia and try and make it to Australia.
author: TimOfAltona

text: If you do then perhaps you sit with the Greens, but if you don't then you should be supportive of what this government ( and the Labor government before) were doing to deter boat departures from Indonesia.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Unfortunately while the majority of Australian voters will be applauding the government efforts and achievements in this area, a number of bitter and twisted Labor supporters will be desperately hoping and praying the boats start up again.
author: TimOfAltona

text: The Labor/Greens cheer squad swarm all over anything to do with weather or asylum seeker boats because they see those two issues as key reasons to their thrashing last Sept.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Melbourne has had hot spells like this going back thousands of years - the last one like this was 100 years ago and the next one will probably be in another 100 years. Blaming a government that has been government for a matter of weeks reflects on your utter stupidity.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Yes boys and girls with any luck the boats will start up again after that and we can all jump and down with glee, clap our hands and claim the government are lying.
author: TimOfAltona

text: It was very interesting when articles about Australia's asylum seeker problem and the Australian government response finds it's way onto front page overseas editions of the Guardian and comments are opened up.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Reality is though that the government's initiatives are cutting through, the boats are slowing or even stopping and the majority of Australians can see that this government is delivering on a core election promise.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Patrick, you completely left out the bit where the Rudd/Gillard government was tapping into the phones of SBY and his wifeyou could only muster enough strength to attack Howard and Abbott goats.
author: TimOfAltona

text: The bugging of his wife's phone was nothing to do with Tony Abbott - if you recall these accusations stem back to when Labor were in govt - you make it sound as if Abbott ordered the phone tapping.
author: TimOfAltona

text: I love how Abbott is cranking up the anger from the Labor/Greens pompom waivers by not publicly commenting on this - they so desperately want him to make some statements so they can shoot him down in flames irrespective of what he says - the fact he is saying nothing and is a small target is driving them nuts - smart move by Abbott.
author: TimOfAltona

text: So while the Labor/Greens frilly skirt squad all rally in behind the Indonesian government , the Abbott government is quietly getting on with the job we elected them to do - stopping the boats.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Sprouting left wing scare mongering to try and land cheap blows on the government won't cut through to the majority of Australian voters who support what this government is doing in dealing with people smugglers and Indonesia.
author: TimOfAltona

text: To be fair you are correct, we don't yet know the extent of dysfunction in the latest ALP team - certainly dysfunction was the hallmark of the Rudd/Gillard/Rudd years and yes, the ALP did achieve some good outcomes over the 6 years despite the dysfunction and minority status.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Only problem is that this particular 'hired staff' was the puppet master of a sitting PM - ever since the ALP brought him out from UK Labor to 'improve' Gillard's image and polling, he scripted her day in day out and she went along with it - until it actually destroyed her political career (& the Labor party)
author: TimOfAltona

text: I think it's great the government are sending a strong message to both the people smugglers and the Indonesian government that Australia will not allow it's borders to be breeched by people smuggling activity.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Perhaps it's time Indonesia started to carry some of the responsibility for allowing people smugglers to operate do freely within their borders instead of leaving all the heavy lifting up to the Australian Government.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Fair assessment, this was never going to be solved in a matter of weeks- adding to the equation is the Indonesian elections - that will impact on any progress for a while as well.
author: TimOfAltona

text: My recommendation to you is you need to accept that Labor lost the last election by a country mile and it will be many years before whoever will be the leader of the ALP then will be PM - 9 or more at least.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Brilliant comment - Indonesia needs to start taking on some of the heavy lifting here instead of allowing corrupt officials to wave the boats off as they depart Indonesian ports.
author: TimOfAltona

text: I think it's great the government are sending a strong message to both the people smugglers and the Indonesian government that Australia will not allow it's borders to be breeched by people smuggling activity.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Perhaps it's time Indonesia started to carry some of the responsibility for allowing people smugglers to operate so freely within their borders instead of leaving all the heavy lifting up to the Australian Government.
author: TimOfAltona

text: They only ended up with tens of thousands arriving on our shores via people smuggling activity and adding billions of dollars of cost to the Australian tax payer. Yes they definitely need to be back in control once again.
author: TimOfAltona

text: C'mon David, you and I both know the answer to this - if he appears on TV to make a statement you and your comrades attack like junk yard dogs every word he utters and if he does not appear on TV you attack him for not fronting up and making a statement.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Don't dismiss McTernan as a mere 'staffer'. You and I both know he was scripting Gillard's speeches and responses to anything and everything - hell he was the architect of her misogyny speech - pretty much every wrote word for her.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Be careful, all you lefties were quickly sucked in by the shots fired and now you just as quickly get sucked in by spurious allegations by a Somali refugeeno wonder you guys are in a minority grouping when it comes to public opinion over this matter.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Also, thanks for reminding us once more about David Marr's book - it must be around 20 separate occasions you've pushed his book over the past 2 days - spam filter may need to be engaged.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Funny how 18 year old Somali refugee making untested perhaps spurious allegations have an instant friend in the Labor/Greens cheer squad who embrace him as a lifelong member of the ALP.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Shorten will never be a Labor PM and I think most of them see that - once Shorten has gone who will replace? Is Kev looking for another comeback perhaps?
author: TimOfAltona

text: As the success of the operation becomes apparent they have nothing left in the locker but grubby comments and childish name calling - yep that'll get Labor back in office for sure.
author: TimOfAltona

text: It seems the only people concerned over this matter are the Labor/Greens commentators in this threadthe left seem to have taken it very personally indeed that Australia had the temerity to enter their good friend Indonesia's territorial waters.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Funny thing is most of your fellow countrymen and women back in the UK give this government a resounding thumbs up for their actions in stopping people smuggler operations.
author: TimOfAltona

text: You need to have think about what it mean to have hundreds of people smuggling boats hitting our shores each week because you want to see the government measures fail.
author: TimOfAltona

text: 3 long years to go pal by which time all the Coalition's pre-election commitments will be fulfilled and Labor will be left like a shag on a rock with no where to go.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Natasha, it's all confected anger - they actually don't give a toss whether our boats went into Indonesian waters or not - it gives them a nice little platform to try and land blows against the government.
author: TimOfAltona

text: When the navy became aware they had inadvertently entered Indonesian waters they reported that fact to Morrison who went on to advise the Indonesian government of the error and apologise.
author: TimOfAltona

text: There is nothing to support your assertions about Operation Sovereign Borders what so ever, in fact it has been a successful operation as evidenced by the drop in boat arrivals.

text: Swan was a goose, Gillard was economically naiive and in the greatest of Labor traditions Rudd just spent, spent, spent and kept on spending when there was no money left in the bank.
author: TimOfAltona

text: The government should not and will not cave into blackmail from asylum seekers who jumped the UNHCR queue and now want to be processed ahead of others courtesy of media stunts.
author: TimOfAltona

text: This tactic is usually started by some advocate on the outside who talks them into using this tactic as a way to get media attention - which is just what has happened.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Their first mistake is that they are now dealing with a Coalition government - no longer the hapless Labor government that encouraged them to come here by boat in the first place.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Not sure what it is the Greens sing - so suggest if any of you 3 are from the Greens you too can sing 'Solidarity Forever' in support of your coalition partner, the ALP.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Not sure why the Guardian needs to make a headline story re Abbott's baddies vs baddies comment other than to pander to the regular cabal of left wing nut jobs posting on here.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Thanks Helen for your input, but I would prefer to hear the definition proposed by the author of the comment - something tells me though it will not be forthcoming.
author: TimOfAltona

text: The new government can only get away with blaming all our economic woes on the previous government for so long before they have to make their own mark by delivering on credible initiatives particularly for those at the poorer end of the socio-economic scale.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Old age pensions and new start allowances almost certainly need to increase and I think the new govt get this - how we pay for this reform is the challenge.
author: TimOfAltona

text: LOL, won't need to with only 3 people turning up for a march...at least there are 2 of them to hold the banner...perhaps the 3 person turning up can belt out a few lines of "Solidarity Forever"
author: TimOfAltona

text: Fair to say both sides have been feeling their way to some extent - the newly installed Abbott government coming to terms with actually being in government after 6 years in opposition and Labor, with a new look leadership team trying to rebuild after 6 years of bruising and destructive internal factional & leadership battles plus the inherent challenges emanating from a hung parliament.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Both sides still have their 'P' plates on and mistakes will inevitably occur and to be fair to Tony Abbott, since becoming PM he has been true to his word going about fulfilling his core campaign promises albeit without the level of transparency expected by some journalists and seemingly demanded by Labor and Greens supporters.
author: TimOfAltona

text: The government are certainly yet to prove themselves and they would be aware that, apart from the opposition supporters who had already made up their minds by 10 pm on September 7, there are millions of voters who are expecting this government to deliver on a broad spectrum of positive economic, social, industrial, educational and environmental change. They will need to be seen achieving some of this over the next 3 years to ensure a second term in office.
author: TimOfAltona

text: With 90 seats in the lower house, the Coalition should be in the box seat to drive a return to the reforming centre - although with senate voting intentions from July still largely unresolved (PUP wildcard) Labor and The Greens may yet have the ability to poke a stick in the government's eye just because they can and the bitterness has the potential to endure.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Nothing like a bit of good ol left wing denial to keep Labor out of office for the next decade - I thought Labor supporters would have learnt their lesson after the Gillard experiment.
author: TimOfAltona

text: In light of the new allegations re trade union corruption in the Victorian building industry perhaps it's time to amend a well known ditty they all sing along to at ALP/trade union conferences
author: TimOfAltona

text: Right here is why Labor will be in opposition for the next decade or so - close your eyes, block your ears and pretend everything is ok in camp Labor.
author: TimOfAltona

text: When you are caught out big time, as with the Victorian building industry, all you want to do is blame the government and the media for Labor's obvious failings.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Speaking of Victoria - I wonder how the political arm of the Trade Union movement, aka the ALP lead this month by Shorten, will handle the fall out from yet another corruption scandal involving unions in Victoria - this time the building industry.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Something here does not add up - if conservative governments are so evil and people are sick and tired of conservative governments retrenching thousands of workers, closing down industries and training facilities and looking after the rich, then why are the Labor governments in Tas and SA about to be thrown out and conservative governments installed in the forthcoming state election?
author: TimOfAltona

text: Oh yes, a 15 year old report by 2 left wing 'academics' from Melb Uni - must be true then and on that basis alone the government should immediately abandon all plans to further evaluate the merits or otherwise of the scheme.
author: TimOfAltona

text: The Labor cheer squad tried this one on in the lead up to the election - seemingly forgetting that their poster girl Julia Eileen Gillard was born in Wales.
author: TimOfAltona

text: They desperately attempt to shoot the prospect of work for the dole down in flames as they do with every other policy the government went to the election with.
author: TimOfAltona

text: The greatest fear for the Labor/Greens cheer squad is that the government might actually successfully deliver on their pre-election policies and go on to win by even more seats in 2016.
author: TimOfAltona

text: If Gillard was held in SO high regard, why is it that it was her own party that chopped her off at the knees and disposed of her like she was some kind of wooden puppet consigned to the scrap heap (before the Australian voters got to do the honors)?
author: TimOfAltona

text: The Labor/Greens/Indonesian cheer squad always look the other way and go all silent when you mention Labor's disgraceful impost on this country - not to mention the 1000+ lives lost at sea.
author: TimOfAltona

text: With the Indonesian elections bearing down there will be plenty of confected sabre rattling going on amongst the candidates and their aligned media outlets over who is seen to standing up to Australia the hardest.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Despite the best efforts of the Labor supporters to stir Indonesia up over this, Indonesia will soon back down, go back into their box and the same ol same ol corruption will continue.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Yes, I agree, that we should support Indonesia when they have the guts to stand up to Australia, it makes it a whole lot easier for them to continue to avoid scrutiny over the killings and human rights abuses in West Papua and the murdering militia gangs they sponsored in East Timor not to mention turning a blind eye to the corruption amongst their military and police that allows the people smugglers to operate so freely in their ports.
author: TimOfAltona

text: You will all feel a great sense of pride when the PM addresses the forum at Davos later today - suggest everyone here tune in and witness how much Abbott's stature has grown in the eyes of the world.
author: TimOfAltona

text: So in other words - if Labor win any of the forthcoming elections/by-elections it is due to national politics but if Labor lose any of the forthcoming elections/by-elections it is due to local/state issues?
author: TimOfAltona

text: The obvious weakness in your hypothesis is that in the unlikely event Labor actually retain govt in SA or TAS, all the Labor/Greens cheer squad will be screaming from the roof tops that it was because the Abbott government is unpopular.

text: Take no notice - most of these Labor/Greens cheer squadders would still attack/criticise the governments choice irrespective of who is chosen for the role - Abbott could have put Julia Gillard up for it and they would still be attacking him for his choice.
author: TimOfAltona

text: With Shorten leading the ALP (this month at least) his close union ties will place him fairly and squarely under the hammer if any royal commission is convened to investigate the corruption allegations.
author: TimOfAltona

text: ..and yes, your anti-dumping argument is valid. An anti-dumping authority was commissioned, under Gillard I think, but it seems to be toothless tiger. They have apparently determined that Italian canned tomatoes were in fact 'dumped' but no action has been taken that I can see to curtail the activity.
author: TimOfAltona

text: To the lefties on here trying to drum up support for a rag tag anti-government 'march'' - thanks so much for confirming in the minds of Australian voters why we voted for a Coalition government - there is no place for radical extreme leftwing crazies marching through our streets.
author: TimOfAltona

text: I'm with you - that's the best way we can help keep SPC afloat - the problem is the supermarket duopoly who 'home brand' using cheap and clearly inferior imported product from China, Italy, South Africa etc are not supporting SPC - then again ,they would not sell the cheap imports if consumers did not buy them. Hmmmmmm..
author: TimOfAltona

text: Pal, these businesses were already on the way out under the socialist Labor government, Gillard kept throwing our money to prop up manufacturing businesses (presumably at the direction of the ACTU et al) yet they still floundered and shut down and guess what? - our debt levels blew out to mega proportions.
author: TimOfAltona

text: There is only so much a government can do to prop up uncompetitive industries, the biggest being to manage the economy in such a way that business can flourish and be competitive - this where Labor fail time and time again and it's up to conservative governments to recalibrate the economy following Labor administrations (best as global pressure will allow) and get the nation back in business.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Two very different propositions - you are trying to link climate change measures with a failing manufacturing business. - a business that was also failing terribly under the 6 years of a Labor government.
author: TimOfAltona

text: The ball is back in the court of Coca Cola Amatil, the parent company that posts hundreds of millions of dollars profit each year - if they can see a future for this business i.e.: it will actually survive then they will come to the party.
author: TimOfAltona

text: The CFMEU saga rolls on and will only benefit the government and may well be the catalyst for the Coalition retaining government in 2016. A royal commission into the building industry will open up a massive can of worms for the ALP which is why we see Labor and their supporters so desperate to shut it down before it starts.
author: TimOfAltona

text: The 'stoush' with Indonesia over people smugglers has benefitted the government enormously - apart from the small group of Labor/Greens supporters who 'befriended' both the Indonesian government and the people smugglers right to send boats laden with asylum seekers to our shores, most Australians appreciate the governments efforts in shutting down the people smugglers and taking a firm approach with Indonesia over this. A winner for the government.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Great decision by the government - if SPC's owner, one of the largest multinationals in the world regard SPC as too risky and won't put up the money, then why should the Australian taxpayer?
author: TimOfAltona

text: Generally of a high quality - not sure which government allowed them to accept commercial sponsorship in the form of commercials, but it was a good move and means they will be around for a long time to come.
author: TimOfAltona

text: The ABC will always be with us - at least for the next 30 years or so. The Australian political merry go round of Liberal/Labor/LiberaI/Labor federal governments will see to that.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Your point re public broadcasting service is valid and I think it is important to keep free access to some MSM digital news services. ABC news coverage is by and large of a pretty good standard in my opinion.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Yep, the people smugglers, Indonesian government, asylum seekers making confected claims against the navy and now the ABC - all have never had better friends than the Labor/Greens cheer squad.

text: You need to go back and remember the events surrounding the ABC being awarded the International Broadcasting rights under a highly contentious and botched tender process by the Gillard government.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Jim I would add that Australia does bear it's fair share of accepting genuine asylum seekers through the UNHCR program and yes, most of these asylum seekers end up assimilating well into Australian communities and make a solid contribution to Australia's future.
author: TimOfAltona

text: You would agree that there has to be some kind of border control or this situation would be completely out of hand with potentially thousands attempting the sea crossing each month outside the UNHCR program.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Get into the real world - the same procedure is used in camps all over the world, it's for everyones' safety - children are quite capable of hiding something that could harm themselves or others and if adults thought that children were exempt from searches imagine some of the tragic consequences.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Had Rudd won the last election and he and Tony Burke were administering the policy they introduced before the election (Manus and Nauru) then 70% of the commentators in these Guardian threads would be supporting the Labor government's efforts to deter and shut down the people smugglers and stop the drownings.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Pat, you well know that police have few powers when it comes to investigating corruption allegations such as these. They cannot interview someone who does not wish to be interviewed - and guess what - none of the union people involved will speak or co-operate with a police investigation.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Only a royal commission has the wide ranging powers necessary and required to cut through to the truth - and therein lies the problem for the ACTU and their political arm and why they are so actively campaigning against it (along with the Labor supporters on the Guardian site).
author: TimOfAltona

text: But the reality there is an abundance of wrong doings that will probably be uncovered by a Royal Commission - the last thing Dave Oliver and the leader of his political arm Bill Shorten want exposed is the alleged endemic corruption within some sectors of the union movement.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Abbott has only been PM for a few months and parliament has only sat for a short time - give him time to get plenty legislation through this year.
author: TimOfAltona

text: We are NOT ion conflict with Indonesia and we are NOT the laughing stock of the world - that's only in the minds of a few Labor/Greens supporters who are still living in denial.
author: TimOfAltona

text: I thought it was Rudd & Gillard who had done more harm to Australia in the last 4 years - their infighting and back stabbing nearly wiped out the ALP.
author: TimOfAltona

text: The ALP are crying because News Ltd refuses to be their lap dog. To attack and besmirch journalists for doing their job in holding Government accountable and referring to them as being unfaithful and unpatriotic is a warning sign of a despot at the helm.
author: TimOfAltona

text: There is growing suspicion both within the ABC and other sources that the Navy 'toture' allegations were fabricated by the people concerned who were acting on advice to try and rip compensation from the Aust govt.

text: On your first point I disagree - she was a shambles during the Rudd-Gillard war of the roses - tried to back both sides and then got herself all twisted up and started sprouting John McTernan scripted nonsense.

text: On your second point - you gotta feel sorry for Bill - won't be able to drop into his mother-in-laws Canberra pad and quaff taxpayer funded bottles of beaujolais over his tax payer funded dinners for much longer.
author: TimOfAltona

text: And yes - I agree with you on his leadership which is also felt by a large number of the Labor cheer squad - I keep saying - you should have gone with Albo when you had the chance.

text: I don't see how becoming an 'independent' would give her more influence in federal government - I would say the opposite is true given the massive majority the Coalition have in the Lower House.

text: You keep banging on about how Labor have stopped the boats - funny you never seem to comment on how Labor started the whole people smuggling fiasco back in 2007 under Rudd - tens of thousands of asylum seekers arriving in people smuggler boats and 1000+ lives lost at sea and billions of dollars cost to the Aust tax payer.

text: Not sure why this is even a news story apart from the fact that it confirms the Coalition are delivering on their election promise to stop the boats - don't the left hate it when we hear of the success of Operation Sovereign Borders - they desperately want the boats to keep reaching Australia.

text: Poor guy, the Labor supporters attack anyone and everyone who are linked to the new government - the grubby comments about the new GG the other day spring to mind.

text: Yes I am happy to condone - along with the millions of other voters ready to put the Coalition back in for the second term as amongst other things, a reward for stopping the boats.

author: TimOfAltona

text: All the off shore detention centres were closed down during the Howard years - the same will happen in the second or third term of the coalition government, then you'll have nothing more to bitch and moan about..
author: TimOfAltona

text: The Barati death was a tragedy and should never have happened, a view firmly held by Immigration Minister Morrison. Things clearly got out of control on Manus and we are all now much wiser with hindsight and no doubt with several inquiries underway, the security of transferees on Manus will be significantly enhanced.
author: TimOfAltona

text: How many lives has this government saved as result- hundreds?? - we will never know but even if ONE life has been saved by shutting down the people smugglers then it has been worthwhile.
author: TimOfAltona

text: We all eagerly await the 4 Corners investigation into the Rudd government kick starting the Indonesian people smuggling industry which lead to the deaths of 1000+ men, women and children at sea.
author: TimOfAltona

text: As we have with Mr Barati, let's start giving these 1000+ men, women and children an identity - you know, names, ages, backgrounds, aspirations, interview with friends and families and what it was about the ALP's 2007 policy that encouraged/tempted them to get into leaky people smuggling boats and try to make it to Australia?
author: TimOfAltona

text: In 2016 you and evry other Australian will have every opportunity to judge this governments actions in shutting down the people smuggler trade - something Labor were found wanting with.
author: TimOfAltona

text: So,let me get this straight - a future  looking for pre-selection goes public with untested and unverified allegations designed to damage the Coalition and all the Labor/Greens cheer squad whip themselves up into a frenzy like sharks at feeding time.
author: TimOfAltona

text: These people come from the left side of politics in Australia. The left were soundly beaten in last years federal election so they are using the MH370 tragedy to try and score cheap political points against the Australian government.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Good news for the asylum seekers. They knew they would not be resettled in Australia if they came here in people smuggler boats instead of going through the orderly UNHCR program so this is a not unreasonable outcome for them.
author: TimOfAltona

text: The 1000+ asylum seekers who drowned following Rudd's dismantling of Howards border protection policies only have themselves to blame because noone forced them onto the boats, yet the Coalition are totally to blame for the death of 1 person in the Manus Island detention centre during a riot.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Poor ol Chippendale - about the only person left in Australia who still worships the ground Gillard walks on - has not accepted that Labor were crushed in the last election - just  seats is it they hold in a 150 seat parliament?
author: TimOfAltona

text: Let's all get back to reality here - Labor are out of government for many many years to come - Labor simply are unable to present themselves as a viable alternative government for all the reasons we know so Chippendale may as well hop over to the good side and start supporting this government as it goes about the business of securing Australia's future - and yes, that Chippendale and his family.
author: TimOfAltona

text: You gotta laugh - so desperate are Labor supporters who can see their own party sinking so fast they want to engage with the Nats to try and keep Labor afloat - they tried with the Greens and it all turned to crap.
author: TimOfAltona

text: There has been a shortage of boats arriving in the post few months - the Labor/Greens cheer squad can't stand that thought - it is vital for them and their anti-government campaign that the boats keep arriving.
author: TimOfAltona

text: The people smugglers desperately want to see Labor get back into governmemt, preferably with the Greens helping them to form government - this is their green light to start up their insidious trade again.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Thanks for confirming the Labor/Greens cheer squad want to see the people smugglers succeed - after all if they do prosper it gives you the opportunity to say the Coalition have failed.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Bizarre that the Labor/Greens cheer squad want to be so subservient to Indonesia - it's like they regard Indonesia is some kind of supreme overlord that we must bow and scrape to.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Newsflash: This is no longer the dysfunctional government of a giggling, inept and scripted Julia Gillard - this is a government that is taking a stand for Australia's interests and won't be dictated to by Indonesian people smugglers aided by corrupt Indonesian officials.
author: TimOfAltona

text: No amount of kicking and screaming fom leftwing losers in these threads changes the fact that this government has achieved something the dysfunctional Labor/Greens government was never able to do.
author: TimOfAltona

text: It looks like the Labor/Greens cheer squad have completely overlooked the fact that apart from the Labor government opening up our borders in 2007 and starting up the Indonesia people smuggling business again, which lead to the current mess, it is also Indonesian apathy and corruption that allowed the people smuggling business to flourish.
author: TimOfAltona

text: It is real shame for this country that the hapless Gillard and incompetent Swan were able to form a minority government 3.5 years ago - it meant we had another 3 years of Labor's greatest achievement - record debt and deficit.
author: TimOfAltona

text: The Commission of Audit are telling it how it is - Labor wear significant responsibility for we are at and as in previous decades it will take a Coalition government to fix it all up again.
author: TimOfAltona

text: I'll scour your history to read your comments calling for the resignation of the conga line of Labor Immigration Minister's under whose watch 1000+men, women and children drowned at sea.

text: With the Coalition now in government and fixing up the Labor/Greens mess the offshore processing centres will eventually be emptied out as genuine asylum seekers are resettled in countries other than Australia and the non-genuine ones are returned to their country of birth.
author: TimOfAltona

text: This is great news - the people smugglers have been shut down, people are no longer drowning in their hundreds or thousands and the offshore processing centres will be closed down.

text: I don't follow your argument - are you saying the perperators of Mr Barati's death are other asylum seekers and the asylum seekers claiming to be 'eye witnesses' are in danger from them?

text: These people will say anything in order to get to Australia - no doubt coached by the pro bonos who reckon they know all the loop holes. If they are sent to Australia from Manus another 30 will suddenly be 'eyewitnessess' seeking protection.

text: I understand Labor have a surplus of heavy duty shredders they brought in when they lost government - they were being used 24/7 2 or 3 weeks  the election.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Get over it - this has been part of the fabric of Australian politics for decades. Labor were doing it and lord knows the Greens would be doing it too, except noone would pay to hear Christine Milne speak - the Greens would have to pay people to turn up.

text: I knew you guys would not let me down - while you are at it can you please let Chippendale know that the asylum seekers headed to Cambodia are not being sent into the clutches of Pol Pot as he was asserting the other week.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Labor thought they had the Greens locked safely away in the marital bedroom only to discover the Greens had broken open their chastity belt, climbed out the window and had a fling with someone else.

text: Deep down both parties know that united they survive but divided they perish so they have booked themselves into the local office of Gillard and Brown Marriage Counselling Services for expert advice.

text: The Greens with their seat count of 1 will find it somewhat challenging to form government - even then, Bandt is only in parliament because the Libs put him there with preferences.

text: Times may be changing but I think we may be looking sometime into the next century before the Greens may have enough seats to form government in this country - my prediction is never.

text: The Greens always said they would support it providing the threshold was reduced and Labor, well Labor just thrashed around talking about themselves and squabbling amongst each other in their usual dysfunctional state.

text: If the reality for Abbott is that he needs to compromise on the threshold to pass it through the senate then so be it. It will still be a massive win for him and will be welcomed by working mothers around the country who qualify - which is most of them.

text: Ross makes some valid points but I think the millions of dollars of Australian aid (Australian taxpayer dollars) should not be seen as irrelevant to the equation - also there is the elephant in the room over the 'small' issue of West Papua.

text: Yes, Indonesia is a vast archipelago but make no mistake, every boat that leaves has been assisted in some part by someone in authority in the local area, either directly or by turning a blind eye in return for payment.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Indonesia needs to take on more of the heavy lifting to shut down the people smugglers - leaving it all up to Australia are not the actions of a good neighbour.
author: TimOfAltona

text: The end game here was to shut down the people smugglers by denying them a product to sell. It's clearly cutting through, so instead of thousands arriving by boat each week under Labor accompanied by 1000+ drownings, we are almost down to zero people smuggler boats laden with human cargo departing Indonesia.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Rank and file members of the Labor party are not the problem nor can they influence change, it is the union factions that hold the real power and this is why we see Bill Shorten as ALP leader and the failed Gillard experiment earlier.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Shorten needs desperately to reform his party if Labor are to have any hope in forming a government in the next 6-9 years - can he do it and weaken the union power base?
author: TimOfAltona

text: He does make a good point re putting them to work to assist the PNG economy whilst they are awaiting processing. Not sure the left would support that proposal - I can hear the cries of 'slave labour' already.
author: TimOfAltona

text: I recall that PNG is the largest recipient of Australian taxpayer dollars - without Australian aid PNG would be almost a basket case - could this be a classic case of biting the hand that feeds you?
author: TimOfAltona

text: Perhaps Turnbull will be our next PM one day - he would be certain to keep Labor out of government for an extended period. He is gaining support with his Communications portfolio it seems -
author: TimOfAltona

text: Turnbull was always going to replace Abbott as PM one day - it's all a matter of the timing - it may happen in the second or perhaps the third term.
author: TimOfAltona

text: People don't usually comment on poll results unless their side that has the favorable result - if their side is behind in any given poll, they tend to go quiet, look the other way & pretend it is not there (unless their only comment is to say the polls are rigged) . We saw this with the polling leading up to last years federal election.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Bottom line here is these poll results were to be expected in the lead up to what was always going to be a tough first budget for the incoming government.
author: TimOfAltona

text: There are still 2.5 years to go before the next election - an eternity in politics and plenty of time to assess whether the Coalition's budget measures are working for the economy.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Remodelling the GST is only a matter of time away - it will take a poltically brave government to legislate changes, but it will happen one day - the NZ National Government (Conservative) raised the GST across the ditch and the country is still standing , in fact they are in a better fiscal position based on per head of population than Australia.
author: TimOfAltona

text: David, don't know if you happened to see Q&A on the ABC last Monday night - but I reckon that particular group of panelists were the best we've seen for months - highly intelligent, articulate and passionate for their causes.
author: TimOfAltona

text: If they could only sit in a room and thrash out a map/plan for Australia's future we could do a lot worse - the best of Labor's social policies coupled with the best of the Coalition's fiscal good management. Turnbull was on the panel - he will make a great PM one day.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Don't know if you happened to see Q&A on the ABC last Monday night - but I reckon that particular group of panelists were the best we've seen for months - highly intelligent, articulate and passionate for their causes.
author: TimOfAltona

text: If they could only sit in a room and thrash out a map/plan for Australia's future we could do a lot worse - the best of Labor's social policies coupled with the best of the Coalition's fiscal good management.

text: The Coalition are on the right track - they will embrace/adopt some of the Audit Commission's report - the key thing here is that something is being done to repair Labor's debt and deficit.

text: The government would not be too concerned and be too concerned re polling results a) before the budget and b) this far out from an election - with over 2 years to go.

text: Hate to be the bearer of bad news cheer squadders - 2.5 years is an eternity in politics - Labor and the Greens have no hope in hell of forming another government in 2016.

text: Hang on, petrol excise was originally a Labor policy abolished by Howard to help him save the election for the Coalition and ever since the government of the day has missed out on billions of dollars in tax revenues.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Now for the GST - when will we see that increased to 12% (where it probably should be). That would solve a heap fiscal problems for this and successivegovernments - NZ went down that path and their economy is powering along.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Fact remains, Abbott is the preferred PM over Shorten and the government will prevail at the next election - next weeks tough budget will be but a distant memory in 2016. Loooooong way to go and plenty of time for the government to get back on top - and they will.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Clearly Abbott and his Cabinet have some tough decisions to make on how to extract Australia from it's current debt and deficit problems and how to lay the foundations for structural change to benefit the nation over the next couple of decades.
author: TimOfAltona

text: I doubt Labor will stand in the way too much with the upcoming budget measures, after all, our money dried up under their watch and we were left running the country on overseas borrowings.

text: I very much doubt the Nigerian government  to see hundreds massacred in that village two days ago nor  to see 300 school girls kidnapped and subjected to unspeakable horrors - I suggest the Nigerian government has pretty much lost control of the situation and international assistance is needed to prevent ongoing atrocities against innocent people.
author: TimOfAltona

text: No one should underestimate Tony Abbott. He is arguably one of the most successful politicians this country has seen - how many Labor PM's did he see off in opposition and then go on to win,reducing Labor to a rump of it's former self in the Lower House.

text: But the people have dictated our policies - they democratically elected a Coaltion government to 'Stop the Boats' and that is exactly what the this government is going about doing - the nation asked for it.

text: If the nation wants to start up the boats again then all they need to do is vote in a Labor/Greens government in 2016 and hey presto! your people smugglers will be back in business.
