text: As much as you want to see the people smugglers dictate who comes to Australia and when, the reality is we now have a government with the resolve to shut them down.
author: TimOfAltona

text: The left have well and truly lost the battle on this one - there is no overwhelming support amongst Australians to reopen our borders to all who can make it here by people smuggler boats.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Bruce appears to favour unrestricted migration by anyone claiming refugee status. How many detention centres does he think Australia will need to accommodate the tens of thousands who will be incentivised to attempt the journey via people smuggler boats? 10, 50, 100, 500?
author: TimOfAltona

text: Perhaps he is on the same ticket as Sarah Hanson-Young who wants zero detention/processing centres and everyone who comes here be released straight into the community while their claims are processed?
author: TimOfAltona

text: Where are these people going to live? They cannot work so they can only survive on Centrelink handouts which means they are surviving below the poverty line. The charity organsiations would go into melt down unable to cope with the demand.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Hundreds of thousands of genuine refugees have been welcomed into Australia through an orderly and regulated UNHCR program - they have been afforded housing, jobs, health care, education and most have assimilated well into their local communities and taken up Australian citizenship.
author: TimOfAltona

text: It is the disorderly and unrestricted entry that the Abbott government is dealing with by following through on a policy it took to the last election - stopping the boats and shutting down the people smugglers - I cannot understand why so many on the left argue that is a bad policy and want to see the government fail in it's efforts to control our borders.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Don't think the boys and girls down at Australian Customs or the immigration boys and girls manning the airport departure/arrivals would appreciate being compared to events 80 years ago in Germany?

text: I am not having a go at her, she has been wheeled in by Shorten as a door stop prop to try and resurrect his increasing irrelevance to Labor's message.

text: They had better cast their eyes to another thread that says something along the lines about labor changing their offshore processing policy to processing onshore and the resultant start up of the people smuggling operations again.
author: TimOfAltona

text: There is no 'unfolding disaster' - the primary aim is to get these people processed and get them out of there - in time the processing centres will be closed down as they were previously.
author: TimOfAltona

text: The 'unfolding disaster' occurred under Labor when 1000's of people were drowning because there was no deterrent in place to discourage people getting on leaky boats and trying to reach Australia - now  was an unfolding disaster of the highest magnitude.
author: TimOfAltona

text: These people boarded boats in Indonesia in full knowledge they would not be able to enter Australia and would end up in Manus or Nauru - which is where they now are.
author: TimOfAltona

text: The primary objective should now be to clear those processing centres out and shut them down. With the boats all but stopped they will no longer be needed in the future (Howard successfully closed them down until Labor reopened them).
author: TimOfAltona

text: The government should fast track processing and provide these people with 4 options - start a new life in the country they are in (PNG or Nauru) and assimilate with the local community, relocate and settle in a third country which is accepting of their refugee status, return to Indonesia or return to their own country if it is safe to do so or they are economic migrants.
author: TimOfAltona

text: That's the point - the election is 2.5 years away - todays polls are meaningless - the government is only just starting out - over 2 years to deliver on the structural reform necessary.
author: TimOfAltona

text: What many in the Labor/Greens camp don't like to face up to is that Labor  for most of 2013 - nothing could have saved them from defeat - it was only a matter of by how many seats (as it turned out Labor salvaged 55 seats with Rudd and it would have been 30 seats with Gillard) -
author: TimOfAltona

text: This was nothing to do with the media, Tony Abbott or Rupert Murdoch - it was all about Labor in a very public war with itself, factions brawling, white-anting, unresolved leadership turmoil, some very bad judgment calls by Gillard and hideous micro-management by Rudd.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Labor's problem for the next 10 years or so is that they will need that long to rebuild, sort out what kind of party they want to be, who their leadership team will be and break away from union domination.

text: This is a good thread to follow the lead up to tomorrow's budget....however there are two other significant events occurring today - Royal Commission into Union Corruption and Royal Commission into the Home Insulation Program.

text: The Ballistic parachute operates in a similar way to pilot ejection seats in military fighters - an explosive device propels the parachute up and opens in a fraction of the time of a traditional parachute - it allows the the pilot to deploy at much lower altitudes, as low as 260 feet depending on the aircraft.
author: TimOfAltona

text: 3. Abbott has always said and keeps saying a GST will only happen if the states are unanimous and it goes to a Federal election for a mandate from the people.

text: Group A - People who would rather cut off their left before voting for the conservative side of politics. If Labor is not in government it matters not who the Coalition have as PM, their mission in life is to attack and tear that individual down by any means possible - so whether it's Tony Abbott, Malcolm Turnbull or  leading the Libs that individual will be relentlessly attacked and vilified irrespective of how good a job they are doing. Group A account for roughly 95% of the regular commentators here as the Guardian have provided them a meeting place to 'hang out' and support each others' ideology.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Group B - People who comment more objectively, they lean towards Labor but from time to time actually agree with something the Coalition are doing and are not afraid to express their view knowing full well they will be shot down in flames by Group A. Group B account for roughly 2% of the commentators.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Group C - People who lean towards the LNP and comment on here with an alternate view knowing that 100% guaranteed they will be attacked and vilified by Group A. Group C account for roughly 2% of the commentators (I wonder why?)
author: TimOfAltona

text: Group D - People who claim they used to vote for the Liberal Party and also voted for Tony Abbott but have now 'switched' to Labor. Group D pleases Group A very much but Group C are a little suspicious. Group D accounts for........well Jim, that's just you on your own it seems.
author: TimOfAltona

text: The policy shows how skewed the Labor governments priorities are. In 2006 Howard introduced similar cuts as part of his welfare to work scheme. At the time Labor opposed the cuts because they left single mothers worse off without offering any improvement to employment opportunities. But in government Labor failed to reverse these cutsand are now implementing an even harsher policy.

text: Had the PM decided to go ahead with the visit, against police advice, and someone was injured I can see all the howls emanating from the Labor/Greens/Socialist Alternative cheer squad now - "The injury(ies) are all Abbott's fault because he went against police advice and visited the Uni"

text: Multiply that by roughly 5, which is closer to the actual job full and part time vacancies and there are 3,250+ jobs available in Tas- get out there and get a job -the government does not owe you a living.

text: Clearly the transition from a spend thrift debt and deficit government to an economically responsible government is not going too well for some - give it time and you will see who is right here.

text: Hockey's budget is all about reversing that trend - it has to be done whether it's Liberal or Labor, but the ALP don't have the ticker for the tough decisions for fear of alienating their voter base - the result is what we have today after 6 years of Rudd/Gillard/Rudd.

text: The GST will invariably increase, either it's base will be broadened or it will increase along the lines of NZ - the latter is preferable and electorally more palatable in my view.

text: I'm with you Ian - 'Election Now" mantra holds about as much water as Shortens 'Light on the Hill' budget reply rhetoric.  There are still 2+ years to go before the next federal election - forget the DD fantasy, it just will not happen.

text: Good luck with that - there are over 2+ years before the next federal election, the senate will be 'conservative friendly' from July (Palmer wants a DD as much as he wants a hole in the head - he'll compromise with Abbott) which means the government's measures will be implemented.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Labor has put up no alternative to fixing the economy - plenty of 'Light on the Hill' rhetoric but no answers to how they will reverse their 6 years of Debt, Deficit and Dysfunction, they have unresolved leadership turmoil (Albo is still the preferred leader), the unions (via Shorten) are fighting hard to retain their control over the ALP and Labor will continue to support the Coalition's 'Stop the Boats' policies for fear of being seen as weak when it comes to border control and shutting down people smugglers (which they were).
author: TimOfAltona

text: Abbott did not bring down a tough budget to win a popularity contest, he brought down a tough budget to get the Australian economy back on track and work the nation towards a surplus for future generations.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Not sure a handful of disaffected people from fringe minority groups would have this government too worried - they have to focus on geting the economy back on track for all Australians.
author: TimOfAltona

text: The QLD ALP opposition find themselves driving around in a Toyota Tarago for a very good reason and not dissimilar to their federal counterparts - debit, deficit and mismanagement of the states finances.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Until Labor can demonstrate to electors that they can manage a state/federal economy without running up billions in debt  then borrowing to pay the interest off the debt, then they have no legitimate claim to government in this country.
author: TimOfAltona

text: What I don't agree with is people adversely commenting on his physical appearance to try and score points - apart from being unfunny it also constitutes a form of bullying and shallow people do it in these threads because they think they are anonymous.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Scroll down and read plenty of comments from people attacking George Christensen's physical appearance - in my view this amounts to on-line bullying perpetrated by cowards hiding behind a veil anonymity.
author: TimOfAltona

text: It would be interesting to see the photos of the people who make these types of comments - are they so perfect in appearance they happily make fun of or ridicule people who they regard as inferior in appearance to themselves??
author: TimOfAltona

text: An individual's views have absolutely no correlation to their physical appearance - everyone is entitled to put forward their ideas without attracting sordid or grubby comments aimed at demeaning or belittling them over their physical appearance.
author: TimOfAltona

text: You do realise that it is only your fellow Labor/Greens cheer squad members that will agree with you - everyone else who listened and were there, including the media and Bill Shorten heard 'grub'.
author: TimOfAltona

text: We wait with baited breath to hear how Labor, the alternative government (yes, you heard it here first) would approach education funding vs the Budget 'Task' as Shorten calls it.
author: TimOfAltona

text: All Bill Shorten could offer this morning was 'Light on the Hill' rhetoric and telling us Labor will let us know their fully costed policies a week or so out from the 2016 election. In the meantime they will get by on slogans of "Lies" and "Broken Promises" for the next 2.5 years and hope that will satisfy their supporters.
author: TimOfAltona

text: The $80bn never existed in the first place - it was a forward estimate Labor agreed to with the states knowing they would never have to deliver on it because they were on the way out of government.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Labor are an empty vessel when it comes to actual policies vs the current government - it's 100% rhetoric followed up by Shorten banging out a few verses of 'Solidarity Forever' hoping that's enough to get them by.
author: TimOfAltona

text: This is where it gets a tad sticky for the die hard Labor supporters - they know it was their government that started up Manus and Nauru last year and the ALP also support the Abbott government on off-shore processing.
author: TimOfAltona

text: The usual suspects are out waving their banners and chanting - good luck to them. This'll all blow over in a few weeks and we're back to getting on with fixing up the economy.
author: TimOfAltona

text: I have a solution - why don't Labor hit Bronnie up for the use of her office for an ALP fundraising dinner (paid for by their union benefactors) and tomorrow's Guardian headline will be
author: TimOfAltona

text: We all pretty much suspect Shorten is weak, but it is not a good look for him to see Labor MP's continuously howling and grunting on the opposition benches like a troop of baboons.
author: TimOfAltona

text: The Labor/Greens cheer squad hate his success - it shows Labor up to be totally inadequate when it came to shutting down people smugglers, protecting Australia's borders and preventing hundreds of deaths at sea.
author: TimOfAltona

text: I suspect Labor are feeling at least a 'twinge' of guilt over the parlous state of the nation's debt they created and then handed over to the Coalition to fix up.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Tony Burke writes to Scott Morrison urging him to release a convicted drug dealer into the community - the same person who has now been charged with running an international drug ring from within Villawood detention centre via his mobile phone.
author: TimOfAltona

text: The bookies are pretty good at predicting outcomes in political races and right now, after what has probably been the worst week for the new government, they still have the Coalition decimating Labor in the 2016 election.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Not taking sides on the NRA debate but it seems to me this mentally unhinged person would have still gone out and killed people even if he had no firearm. He had already stabbed people to death and run others over with his car.
author: TimOfAltona

text: The problem with your argument is that Coalition MP's were not the ones climbing all over their seats and carrying on like heckling baboons at feeding time at the zoo. This is why so many Labor MP's have been ejected. They need to learn a little restraint during QT.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Nothing wrong with a fund raising knees up in her office - as Speaker she is entitled to use the office as she sees fit, as long as the shindig was to her personal account no worries.
author: TimOfAltona

text: A DD election is held and the Coalition are returned (which is what would be expected) given the ALP/Greens are in no fit state to govern the country and Abbott then has a definite mandate to push through his fiscal reform measures - Labor are left reeling and clamouring for Shorten's head on a stick and the Coalition are in power for another 2-3 terms.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Always good to see a PM stick to his or her principles - strong leadership is what's required right now to steer the country back on the track to prosperity.
author: TimOfAltona

text: If your beloved Labor/Greens party were up to the task of governing the media would report on that - don't expect the media to report favorably on Labor when the ALP is racked by internal dysfunction and underperform.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Just pointing out that Labor have form when it comes to releasing costed policies less than a day before polls open - I expect Shorten is going to try and stall for the next 2.5 years and hope that rhetoric and banging out a few bars of "Solidarity Forever' will keep people happy until then.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Labor created the problem - so it's only fair that they tell us how they will fix it if they were in government - unless you just blindly accept that anything Labor may do will be for the good of the nation.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Your point is valid - however in this case there is a difference - it was Labor that created the unsustainable debt and deficit that the present government is trying to fix up.
author: TimOfAltona

text: If Labor, as the architects of our debt and deficit, can only criticize the government's efforts to clean it up without putting forward an alternate plan then they start to look, well, disingenuous.
author: TimOfAltona

text: C'mon, we all know Labor are an empty vessel when it comes to how they would approach the Budget "Task" (Shorten's terminology for Labor's deficit) - apart from smoke and mirrors rhetoric he has nothing, nothing to offer apart from bagging other peoples ideas.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Sooner or later his credibility will be on the line if he keeps avoiding the question on what Labor would do - I think we all know the answer - further debt and deficit.
author: TimOfAltona

text: I'm waiting with bated breath for Shorten's next statement - "We will have fully costed policies available for the Australian people to judge - 24 hrs before the 2016 election"
author: TimOfAltona

text: The LNP is a broad church - plenty of room for some self criticism on some of the policies, the LNP have after all a majority courtesy of voters in this government so the sheer weight of numbers suggest not all with agree with every policy.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Around election time it's traditional for newspapers to throw their support behind one side or the other - in 2007 Rupert backed Kevin Rudd but when News turned against Labor during the unfolding Rudd/Gillard/Rudd disaster all the Labor supporters went feral, preferring to blame the media rather than look at the inherent problems within their own side - problems which still exist today.
author: TimOfAltona

text: My theory is their tactic is to deliberately bait the Speaker so she is forced to eject them - it's as if they are daring her to eject them - they are reminiscent of the hyenas out of The Lion King - put on a brave face but ultimately are cowards.
author: TimOfAltona

text: So it appears it will not only be the Indonesian people smugglers hoping and praying Labor get back in 2016 - dole bludgers will also be hoping for a Labor return.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Oh, so we have it all wrong - it is the fault that Labor were forced to throw the country into billions of dollars of interest payments on overseas borrowings during their 6 years of rule.
author: TimOfAltona

text: There is only so much money to go around - you gotta remember that Labor spent all the nation's money/savings during their 6 years of dysfunction and deceit - the government have to sort out the mess as best they can.
author: TimOfAltona

text: We wait with bated breath to hear how Labor propose to sort out the Budget 'Task' - the problem is all we will hear is rhetoric for the next 2.5 years while Shorten struggles to hold onto his leadership and we won't get to see Labor's 'fully costed' policies until a few hours before the polls open in 2016.
author: TimOfAltona

text: This has been the pattern of behaviour from them since the new government came into power...time to reflect and accept they will be on the opposition benches for at least 2 more terms so time to settle down and start acting like adult representatives of their constituencies.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Mr Berati was indeed a tragedy that should never have occurred and lessons have been learnt - but the bigger picture involves shutting down people smuggling operations and the drownings that accompany that insidious trade.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Where in the cartoon do you reference the fact that Labor have been baiting and goading the Speaker right from the beginning like some kind of perverted payback for their election annihilation?
author: TimOfAltona

text: Here's a little tip for the Labor/Greens cheer squad - volcanoes, earthquakes, tidal waves and the like have nothing to do with climate change - the usual suspects are already blaming the Indonesian volcano and ash cloud on Tony Abbott's climate policy.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Sometimes you just have to cop it and accept that it is a Coalition government in power and that it will be a Coalition PM that will represent Australia at such events.

text: Can't believe that the Saints have gone from a top four side to a bottom 4 side in the space of a couple of seasons - how the mighty fall.
author: TimOfAltona

text: What is it about Labor voters and their inability to comprehend basic voting guidelines - or were they deluding themselves into thinking that they could try and get Rudd across the line by voting multiple times?

text: Love how the Labor/Greens cheer squad swarm to cover Palmer with praise and adulation - you are all being sucked in and you have taken the bait, hook line and sinker! Typical.

text: Palmer will only stay in Parliament until he gets bored or has decided it is no longer useful to his business interests, then PUP disappears from our political scene forever.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Why not just merge the two operations - significant cost savings can be achieved without compromising quality or content whilst providing a better return for the tax payer. Maintain separate channels and keep ABC ad free with SBS operating with commercials as now.

text: This is what happens when you bite the hand that feeds you - perhaps the Refugee Council should not have been so critical of the governments efforts to shut down the people smugglers.

text: Offshore processing centres are here to stay until the current asylum seekers who arrived via people smugglers are processed and resettled in countries other than Australia - Labor and the Coalition are on a unity ticket on this.

text: With the boat arrivals all but stopped, there are no new transferees heading to Nauru or Manus - this is a good thing and shows the government's tough border control policies are working - this is what we voted for.

text: Conditons are not ideal in the processing centres - this Feb report highlights there are things that need to be done to improve conditions - it is up to the government to implement and ensure the well being of the asylum seekers.

text: I was neither cheering on or saying fairs fair when comments were made about Gillard's appearance. Her physical appearance had no bearing on her faults as a politician and the latter is where people should direct their comments/opinions - not cowardly and offensive anonymous remarks about peoples' appearance.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Lately there has been a surge in these types of attacks against Liberal politicians from presumably Labor supporters -.at what point does the right to free speech/opinion cross over into what constitutes on-line cowardly bullying aimed at a persons appearance?
author: TimOfAltona

text: I don't accuse all Labor supporters of engaging in this - but there are a large number operating in these threads who cowardly prey on the physical apperance of others to try and score 'points'.

text: The bigger story here is that a Labor government were applying an up front fee for Uni students of $250 in 1987, whch with inflation would be around $600 in todays money.

text: Let me tell you something - if Turnbull and Palmer wanted a 'secret' meeting it would not have been in a public restaurant resplendant with media photographers and restaurant owners telling us what they ate for entrees.

text: Labor and the Greens have been propping each other up for survival for years now - you merely confirm what we all ready know - Labor and the Greens are but one when it comes to the crunch.

text: Palmer is clearly using the Australian political system as his own pet plaything - he has the wealth to sustain such a folly which is beyond the realm and imagination of ordinary Australians.

text: Funny how a Guardian piece that actually tells it like it is - in this case Wayne Swan's foibles, it catches the Labor supporters off guard and knocks them for six.

text: Newspoll is not kind to the government today and all the Labor supporters are singing it's praises - but hang on, this is a  poll, you know, the one that is totally rigged by Rupert when it reflects favourably on the government and should be totally disregarded as Murdoch propaganda propping up the Abbott government according to the Labor/Greens cheer squad.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Yet somehow today they have found the strength to forgive Rupert and find a new found confidence that Newspoll is actually a very good reflection of how people regard the government - at least until Newspoll turns around and shows the government is back in front and Labor behind - then Newspoll will be totally rigged once more.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Australia has implemented tough border control policies which include turning people smuggling boats around and sending them back to Indonesia and if any asylum seekers make it to Australia they are immediately sent to offshore processing centres in Papua New Guinea and Nauru - never to be settled in Australia.
author: TimOfAltona

text: The Australian government has broken the people smuggling business model which means an orderly and generous UNHCR program prevails in Australia with thousands of asylum seekers applying for and receiving protection through the front door and not the back door via people smugglers.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Q&A should make good viewing tonight - Lucy Turnbull is a star and one of the nicest people you could meet - a worthy addition to the panel.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Agreed, he does not have the charisma one would expect of someone in such a high profile role - but then again Stephen Smith didn't exactly set the world on fire either.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Labor like to create a little mischief over this and their cheer squad all hop on board and give it a run - gosh it's not like Labor don't have experience or anything when it comes to leadership speculation, we've just gone through 6 years of almost daily speculation  they still have the Bill Shorten/Albo debacle to sort out.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Not sure you can deduce 'heading for a Labor landslide' - still 2.5 years to go - that's hundreds of polls away - as you well know polls have a habit of changing direction - it's only a matter of time before they start being favorable to the government - could be a few months away, but it will happen.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Hang on - this person was living in the community, was being supported by a case worker (with whom he had seen only the day before) and by all accounts was going to be granted asylum. He suffered from depression. Depression claims the lives of thousands of Australians each year.
author: TimOfAltona

text: No matter how many hundreds of times you type 'Election Now' it actually won't achieve an early election - you/we still all have to wait for another 2.5 years when the next federal election will be held.
author: TimOfAltona

text: The irony of this early election call by the Labor/Greens cheer squad is that the Abbott government is likely to be returned - people won't trust another Labor/Greens government so soon after the last debacle.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Nothing has happened since Sept to suggest that Labor have remedied any of that - to the contrary, they are still racked by division, uncertainty and lack of purpose/direction.
author: TimOfAltona

text: It was always going to take 2 or 3 terms in opposition to rebuild, find a leader that can take them forward and try and make a fist of government without relying on the Greens to get them over the line.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Herein lies Labor's problem - you just don't know what they stand for any more - even die hard Labor supporters are confused. The various factions are still at war with each other and Shorten is struggling big time to gain traction whilst fending off the Albanese push (or should that be putsch?)
author: TimOfAltona

text: In my opinion, it's only a matter of time before the polls swing back in favor of the government and Labor will be left behind once again desperately searching for leadership, purpose and direction.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Australia  will be a Republic........sits on the same 'To Do' list as a common currency with NZ, a second airport for Sydney and Labor and the Greens 'coming out of the closet' and formalising their union.
author: TimOfAltona

text: This is all a temporary diversion and will soon blow over and Shaw will be gone - let's get back to the main game - the Nov election and let no one forget why Labor lost the last Victorian election - same as their federal counterparts it was all over fiscal incompetence and saddling the state and tax payers with massive debt via their multi-bilion dollar desalination plant white elephant.
author: TimOfAltona

text: NZ have also just announced announced a budget surplus, the economy is going gang busters (on the back of the dairy industry and rebuilding of Christchurch) and with the ecnomy in such good shape many NZ'rs are heading home to live and work from around the world.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Don't know why they keep banging on about it - the governments border protection policy is working, the boats have stopped arriving, the drownings at sea have ceased and we are returning to an orderly and  UNHCR asylum seeker migration program.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Labor and the Greens may have enjoyed/supported people smugglers dictating who comes into our country but this government is deciding who comes here and when and that is what we voted for and will vote for again in 2016.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Sounds like the Labor/Greens cheersquad won't rest until the doors to all asylum seeker processing centres are thrown open and the detainees free to roam the streets and try and etch out a living - problem is, how, with open maritime borders will we cope with the hundreds of thousands who will try and make their way to Australia by sea and also cope with the guilt of the thousands who will drown along the way?
author: TimOfAltona

text: Take a look at the Guardian story/thread on the unfolding disaster in Europe and wake up - if this is your vision for Australia then good luck getting back into government any time soon.
author: TimOfAltona

text: You keep forgetting to mention that the Australian recording of SBY and his wife was done under a Rudd and then Gillard administration - I have yet to read a comment from a Labor/Greens supporter who actually acknowledge that - it's all too convenient to keep blaming Abbott for that and hope enough people believe it.
author: TimOfAltona

text: The Labor/Greens cheer squad are both perplexed and disappointed - having forensically examined the list of recipients looking for anyone or anything that has connections to the Abbott government they have come up with a big fat ZERO.
author: TimOfAltona

text: They did find a former Labor minister though - don't see too many critical of that decision, in fact none. They found a Labor appointed Governer of NSW - don't see too many critical of that decision, in fact none.
author: TimOfAltona

text: You may be a bit confused...these people have already had their claims processed and they have been found to be not genuine refugees as per the UNHCR charter and have been awaiting deportation.
author: TimOfAltona

text: The two weeks is in relation to the data breach by the Immigration dept and allows the people affected to lodge a claim/argument as to why they should still not be returned to their country of origin. Given this issue has been swirling around for some months and all the pro-bono lawyers and refugee advocates have been very active , 2 weeks is plenty of time to submit a response.
author: TimOfAltona

text: The government is providing them an opportunity to advise if the breach is likely to compromise a return to their country of origin - a fair and reasonable thing to do and each will be assessed on their merits..
author: TimOfAltona

text: Not sure why the Labor/Greens cheer squad want to see these people stay in Australia - won't that encourage tens of thousands of unskilled economic refugees to make their way to Australia?
author: TimOfAltona

text: There was a report that the victim was lying in the boat with his legs over the side & dangling in the water - if true, that would explain how this tragedy occurred.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Yes, I'm sure that 70 years ago Churchill decided to invade Normandy knowing that in 70 years time the timing would be perfect to allow the PM of Australia to travel abroad to deflect criticism at home. Clever man that Winston Churchill.

text: She is the embarrassment - c'mon Labor when are you going to go into the second phase of your rebuilding and shed yourself of Shorten and Plibersek - before or after the 2016 election?
author: TimOfAltona

text: Correction - the Labor/Greens cheer squad are doing their very best at trying to keep that alive - you see it's the only thing they can pin on Malcolm and their fear he may one day be PM is starting to consume them.

text: Let's just accept Lucy's explanation that Malcolm went down to the local chinese for a bit of sweet and sour and happened to bump into Clive who was still hungry after the PM's dinner. Martin Parkinson was passing and spotted them through the window, went in, was invited to join them and shared a bit of Clive's peking duck. A passing journo spotted Clive's very distinctive Roller parked outside the restaurant, looked in through the window, spotted the three men taking turns spinning the Lazy Susan and decided to hang around outside to see what happens next and maybe take a few snaps.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Fact the harsh cold reality pal - Gillard was toxic to both the Labor party and the country - in a way it's a shame Shorten and her own party knifed her before the election - had she stayed on, Labor would be lucky to have 30 seats in the Lower House today.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Please share with us the links to Peta Credlin calling for an apology.  Please share with us the links that show that unelected staffers of politicians are fair game when it comes to deeply personal attacks.  Please explain why Clive Palmer can apolgise for his remarks yet you support his offensive remarks about Peta Credlin because you believe remarks were made about an elected politician Julia Gillard and this is some kind of tit for tat retribution?  Sad all round.  Thanks.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Interesting comments on 7.30 tonight with Sarah Ferguson that the American administration are impressed by the way Abbott handled both China and Japan on his recent successful trip up there and also the fact he came away with some wins for Australia - diplomatically a difficult feat to achieve - something the US has had difficulty with for some time.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Also, it seems the Canadian visit drew positive comments from the Canadian press and the US leg has had a good start in NY from a trade delegation perspective.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Well, if it's good enough for Rudd and Gillard to visit, wine and dine with Murdoch in NY when they were PM, it's probably good enough for Abbott as well.
author: TimOfAltona

text: The Labor/Greens cheer squad have all conveniently overlooked the fact that all Australian PM's find their way to Ruperts door when they visit NY - even their beloved Julia Gillard and Kevin Rudd.
author: TimOfAltona

text: She placed herself in his hands and allowed herself to be scripted into the 'misogyny' tactic - McTernan thought this would be an angle to blunt Abbott's attack and keep Rudd at bay.

text: Naturally it will be attacked by the Labor/Greens supporters, along with boat arrivals, fixing up the nation's (Labor's) debt and anything else Abbott went to the election with and is now delivering on.

text: Any Australian PM, Labor or Liberal would be doing the same thing given the plane's reported proximity to Australia. Any Australian PM, Labor or Liberal would be expected to make comment on the progress of the search given Australia is leading it. The PM of the day would be expected to make comment based on the best advice from the multi-nation search experts.
author: TimOfAltona

text: I think it's time the Labor/Greens supporters stopped attacking Abbott for having the audacity to be the Australian PM when MH370 went missing and having the further audacity to report back on search progress from the experts.

text: Alcohol is 'glamorized' in all Western countries yet is probably responsible for more than 50% of all road deaths, homicides, domestic violence, debilitating assaults and injuries and multiple forms of premature death costing western economies hundreds of billions of dollars each year.
author: TimOfAltona

text: What little can be done lies in education from primary school onwards. Much the same as we all learned the terrible consequences of smoking tobacco, the same could work with demonstrating the detrimental effects of too much alcohol on our bodies, our families and friends and our lives in general. The message will sink in with some.
author: TimOfAltona

text: They underestimated him in the lead up to last year's election and look what happened - Labor were decimated and the cheer squad have been playing catchup ever since.
author: TimOfAltona

text: In the mean time, Labor are still searching for legitimacy and purpose and are still a way off from resolving the factional wars and leadership debacles which have plagued them for years. Shorten and Plibersek are mere seat warmers, holding the fort until the next leadership team is installed. My considered guess will be Albanese as leader and Bowen or Burke as Deputy - more likely Bowen as Burke has a whiff of Eddie Obeid on him (ski lodge freebies and all that).
author: TimOfAltona

text: For some funny reason I get the impression that this will all boil down to how much dosh the government will need to hand over. I read somewhere that others are now lining up to claim the waste-land has spiritual significance for them as well...with all due respect to all concerned but this does smack of "show me the compensation".
author: TimOfAltona

text: I travel regularly to the US and move in fairly wide circles over there - don't flatter yourself - Tony Abbott like all other Australian PM's before him, is largely unknown. Most of them couldn't name Australia's "President".

text: This I know - there are a few NYC police and US Gulf war veterans who have spent some time with him over the past couple of days and have come away with very positive opinions/impressions.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Newsflash - the average American wouldn't have a clue who Australia's PM is. Fair bet many of them would still, if asked, come up with John Howard as Australia's PM (due to his relatively high profile during the Bush years).

text: If Ed believes Abbott is the talking point of America - then good on Abbott for having the highest profile of any Australian PM - can only do good for this country.

text: I'm actually way ahead in my predictions - unlike the Labor/Greens supporters who all predicted Abbott would lose last Sept election and also would never shut down the people smugglers operation, amongst others.

text: I think you will find this issue is substantially deeper and more complex than your simplistic comment - Shorten has already offered Labor's bi-partisan support if the government elects to provide assistance to the US in Iraq.

text: Perhaps, but the problem is Isis represents a major Islamic terrorist threat around the world - if they have a 'base' to operate from in Iraq, we can expect a surge in global terrorist attacks.

text: The budget will get through - it may not be in it's current form, but it will get through. Palmer is already signaling co-operation on carbon tax repeal and let's face it - he will always back the conservative side ahead of Labor/Greens.

text: So while Abbott is rubbing shoulders with Obama in Washington, back in camp ALP, Shorten is standing in a cold wet child care centre playground parroting the usual mantra "Budget bad, Labor good" with Kate Ellis standing behind him continuously nodding her head like some wooden puppet.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Oh dear - Labor do have a loooong way to go with their rebuilding program before they become relevant again and will be able to offer up a viable Labor/Greens alternative government - 2 or 3 terms away?

text: If this is the best argument the Labor/Greens cheer squad can come up with then ROLL ON 2016 - only 2.5 years to go before the next Coalition government is sworn in.

text: You know as we all do that Abbott's visit has been termed successful - even Shorten had a good word for Abbott's North American visit this morning "Promoting Australia's best interests overseas".

text: Australia may provide logistical support for this. I would not support and can't see ground troops becoming involved - for exactly the same reasons the US won't want to put troops on the ground there.

text: So it follows then that the Islamic world are also contemplating trade sanctions against Obama's USA and Cameron's United Kingdom and Key's NZ and Harper's Canada and Hollande's France and Merkel's Germany and Rutte's Netherlands and Tusk's Poland and Rajoy's Spain and Di Rupo's Belguim and Kenny's Ireland and so on and so -
author: TimOfAltona

text: The situation in Iraq does not bode well for any sort of peace in that region and also points to Australia being once more caught up in assisting other nations in theaters of war on the other side of the globe - you can see this going on for decades to come.
author: TimOfAltona

text: We can really only provide logistical support for any US intervention in Iraq - I think the last thing we need are Aussie ground troops getting involved for exactly the same reasons the US won't want to commit ground forces.
author: TimOfAltona

text: The US and it's allies can do an enormous amount of damage to Isis from the air - perhaps enough for Iraqi forces to regain territorial control - maybe.
author: TimOfAltona

text: So the much touted meeting with Obama went off without a hitch - all week I've been reading how Obama will 'take Abbott to task" over climate change and will"embarrass Abbott over climate change" - all the lefties were predicting a fractured meeting. LOL.
author: TimOfAltona

text: The meeting went well with Obama saying along the lines "he notes that Tony Abbott has a clear mandate from the Australian people when it comes to climate change measures".
author: TimOfAltona

text: Good to see the Labor/Greens cheer squad all bitter and twisted over Abbott's successful North American visit - all they have left are grubby comments and personal shallow attacks.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Walking the political tight rope between Japan and China is never easy - although Abbott did a pretty good job on his last visit up there (certainly impressed the Americans I see) so Bishop does need to choose her words very carefully. Both Japan and China are essential to Australia's economic growth. So far so good on that front.
author: TimOfAltona

text: There is a reason why Tony Abbott is in this photo with Hugh Jackman and the Labor/Greens cheer squad look other way and don't want to hear it for fear it portrays Abbott in a positive light - Hugh's wife, Deborra-Lee Furness is patron of Australian Adoption Awareness and in December last year Tony Abbott cut the red tape to make it easier for Australian couples, or singles, to adopt children from overseas. Furness is a Tony Abbott fan for his efforts in this area. Hundreds of Australian couples will be able to adopt needy children from oveseas, primarily Ethiopia, Taiwan and South Korea as a result. Good news story.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Worth looking at it - it seems to be working well in the US and supported by Obama. Particularly as it gives students from lower socio-economic and minority backgrounds a real opportunity to enter the middle class corporate world
author: TimOfAltona

text: Blindly opposing it on the basis that it was the the PM visiting the school and labelling it innovative is short sighted and naive by the Labor/Greens supporters - but hey, what's new?
author: TimOfAltona

text: I wonder if John McTernan was with Julia Gillard when she as PM went and had dinner with Rupert - and what about Kevin Rudd - who went with him when he as PM went and had dinner with Rupert?
author: TimOfAltona

text: He has already stated he will run as an Independent - his chances of re-election? About as much chance as Craig Thomson had in regaining Dobell as an Independent.
author: TimOfAltona

text: The previous Labor government saddled the state and rate payers with a multi-billion dollar desal white elephant plant - which will take generations to pay off - if ever. It hit the blue collar voters in Frankston hard.
author: TimOfAltona

text: I think many commentators have got themselves confused - certainly their comments indicate they are - Morrison is referring to the Iraqis who choose to return home voluntarily from Manus or Nauru - he is not proposing to force people to return to Iraq against their will - big difference between the two.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Hanson-Young is saying that we should stop people voluntarily returning home - strange. She wants them to be forced to stay in Australia despite them wanting to return home - everyday Sarah further alienates herself from the thinking of most Australians.
author: TimOfAltona

text: I cannot recall any Australian government, Labor or Liberal, take a strong position on West Papua despite damning evidence that gross human rights abuses, including militarily sanctioned murders, occur on a regular basis.
author: TimOfAltona

text: You miss the point - moving them to Christmas Island will put the people smugglers back into the frame - all of a sudden they have a product to sell once moreand the boats start arriving in their hundreds again.
author: TimOfAltona

text: I see Obama is sending in a couple of hundred US battle ready special forces into Iraq to bolster the protection US embassy personnel and the Baghdad embassy compound - what happens to the Australian embassy - do we send SAS in to protect or evacuate now?
author: TimOfAltona

text: Spot on - most likely around the end of the third term of this government - but could extend to the end of the fourth term if Labor can't get their act together over leadership and party direction.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Actually, Ed Husic scrubbed up pretty well on Q&A last night - potential ALP leadership material - he is a former union official (CPEU and AWU) and that always goes down well in ALP leadership ballots.
author: TimOfAltona

text: He 'gets away with it' because it is what the journos and everyone else already know - Labor/Greens got us into this mess and the Coalition were voted in sort it out...nothing new there.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Hate to be the bearer of bad news, but your beloved Julia Gillard had she survived the night of the Shorten 'Long Knives', would be in the exactly the same position she is now - out of government and awaiting her turn in a witness box at a Royal Commission into criminal union activity near you - perhaps the only difference would be Labor would be a further 20 seats down in the House of reps, such was the level of animosity and distrust Australians felt towards her.
author: TimOfAltona

text: You make it sound as if Australia is already at war in Iraq - perhaps our ground troops will be pushing north of Baghdad any day now - do keep us informed of what happens next in your delusional world of concocted and confected anti-government propaganda.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Spot on - 99.999% of the world have no idea who Tony Abbott is and an even smaller number would have even heard of George Brandis or what he said.
author: TimOfAltona

text: You read way too much into this - this is a storm in a teacup and once Bishop has spoken with the Arab countries and Indonesia this will all blow over faster than you can belt out a few lines of "Solidarity Forever".
author: TimOfAltona

text: Forget the electricity bills down here - what about our water bills after the ALP saddled the state with a multi-billion dollar white elephant desal plant that our great great great grand children will still be paying off in the next 150 years.
author: TimOfAltona

text: No, that's an old LGCS* fable that was disproved - a few try to resurrect the accusation when it suits them - but it has no foundation at all.
author: TimOfAltona

text: The leadership instability down at team Labor continues unabated - this'll keep 'em out of government for at least another 2 terms. You would think Labor learnt their lesson from the Rudd/Gillard civil war years.
author: TimOfAltona

text: If you follow the interview sequence, you will find Abbott is speaking about this only because reporters started questioning him on it - Abbott's presser was called to talk about the budget and carbon tax repeal, not Iraq and border protection.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Your biggest problem will be Labor's ability to mount a credible alternative government challenge by then - I think we all know Labor's toughest times are still ahead of them while they try to rebuild from the Rudd/Gillard civil war years - 2016 is way too soon for Labor to be ready for anything IMHO.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Jim, why shouldn't they milk border protection for all it's worth - it is after all a victory of sorts and one of the key policies they went to and won the last election on.
author: TimOfAltona

text: The 30 SAS are over there with the support of the government and Labor to assist in protecting the skeleton Australian embassy staff, the compound and any Australian citizens seeking shelter if things turn nasty in Baghdad - their primary mission is to assist in the safe evacuation of Australian's if the need arises.
author: TimOfAltona

text: The conflict in northern/western Iraq is much broader than just Iraq - it has the potential to envelop the entire region - Jordan, Syria, Iran, Kuwait and so on - this has massive implications for the rest of the region and beyond. Burying your head in the sand and hoping it goes away won't solve this crisis.
author: TimOfAltona

text: I would not read too much into the polls at this stage - mostly they will reflect badly on the government which is to be expected given the budget schmozzle & the uncertainty in the new senate going on (C'mon Clive vote with the government - you know you want to).
author: TimOfAltona

text: The ALP & it's supporters can bask in a bit of poll sunshine for a while but make no mistake they will turn around and put the Coalition ahead in coming months as the government's policies bed down and Labor's internal woes, particularly over leadership and direction, intensify.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Sometimes you just have to accept things as they are - embracing and salivating over polls that reflect badly on the Coalition one week and then rejecting/rubbishing the same poll a week later when it shows the Coalition coming back does your side no good in the credibility stakes.
author: TimOfAltona

text: This is how polls work - there is no conspiracy going on here - it is what it is. Shooting the messenger when things go badly for you, whether that be a Guardian journalist or a particular opinion poll will not get your side back into government.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Key and Obama played a 5 hour round of golf together in Hawaii last year - the only world leader to get quality time with Obama on the golf course.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Labor does not get a lot of things - half of them are still living in denial believing Tony Abbott and News Ltd are to blame for Labor's woes.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Until they face up to the facts and rebuild the party by sorting out the leadership farce, the factional in-fighting and properly define their relationship with the Greens (are they inside or outside the tent?) the conservatives will remain in government in this country.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Back to this issue, Abbott was the opposition leader - he was being paid to oppose the sitting government to try and win government for the Coalition - it's what opposition parties do. It's what Shorten is doing now.
author: TimOfAltona

text: No. I saw the Tele stuff - calling out a bad government for what it was - a bad government, racked by infighting and dysfunction. It's what the media do. If Labor were not so dysfunctional, they are certain to have received better press.
author: TimOfAltona

text: For months now we've been reading in these threads from the Labor cheer squad how Labor's demise was all down to News Ltd - nothing to do with dysfunction and disarray in the Labor party - oh no it's all Rupert's fault.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Well, it's good to see Labor itself admitting that they were responsible for their own demise - let's hope the Labor cheer squad deniers all take note and stop this constant crap about News Ltd bringing down their government.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Australia's been doing it's fair share of the heavy lifting here and should be congratulated - this humanitarian work can continue in an orderly and responsible way now that the people smugglers operating out of Indonesia have been largely shut down by this government.
author: TimOfAltona

text: There is nothing untoward here - Australia has an obligation to protect it's own embassy and staff plus Australian aid workers etc who may shelter in the embassy compound if things deteriorate in Baghdad.
author: TimOfAltona

text: For all these initiatives to work it is important that as many stakeholders/constituents adopt through understanding how it works and also having access to the technology - particularly when it comes to social services such as Centrelink.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Melissa, I seem to recall that, for very good reason, it is illegal to publish images in the media that can identify individual asylum seekers - yet there is a very clear picture of an Iranian asylum seeker behind wire at the head of this piece?
author: TimOfAltona

text: Under what authority can an Australian minister conduct an inquiry into a police force of another country - particulaly when the police force is as you say supported/protected by the government of the other country.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Angus Campbell's biggest problem is that he is the military spokeperson for a very successful government policy - a policy the Coaliton took to the election and have subsequently delivered on.
author: TimOfAltona

text: This issue alone smacks of another strong win for the coalition in 2016, so unfortunately for Campbell he will be targeted/attacked by the LGCS who so desperately wanted to see the boats keep departing Indonesia and arriving in Australia - for no other reason than to call Abbott a liar.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Well done Angus Campbell and well done Scott Morrison -. shutting down the people smugglers has saved potentially thousands of lives which would otherwise have been lost had Labor's asylum seeker amarda been allowed to continue.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Labor don't seem to get it - ranting, raving and abusing standing orders won't get them re-elected - Shorten needs to pull his team in line or risk further irrelevancy as leader.
author: TimOfAltona

text: The LGCS seem happy to keep borrowing, borrowing, borrowing to keep Labor's spending addiction alive - believing Wayne Swans fantasy predictions of budget surpluses under Labor are just around the corner.
author: TimOfAltona

text: Best we all start acknowledging that tough measures have to be implemented to get the economy and finances into a future proof state - which is why we voted in the Coalition to replace Labor's fiscal mismanagement of debt and deficit IMHO.
author: TimOfAltona

text: You are delusional - the people smugglers are making millions of dollars from their insidious trade - trying to portray them as some innocent, poor and harmless individuals who are 'saving' thousands of people is a load of crap.
author: TimOfAltona

text: The people smugglers have sent somewhere between 1 and 2 thousand people to their death by drowning in unseaworthy boats - how can you claim they are saving lives.
author: TimOfAltona
